title: narukami_yu
body:
The protagonist of [[Persona 4]]. Nephew of [[Doujima Ryoutarou]] and cousin/big brother figure of [[Doujima Nanako]].

Originally nameless in the video game, he is given the name "Seta Souji" in the manga adaptation and "Narukami Yuu" in the anime adaptation.

He is nicknamed [[Banchou]] for a number of reasons:
* His starting Persona, [[Izanagi (persona 4)|]], wears a banchou-style outfit ([[gakuran]] and tall [[geta]])
* In the Miss? Contest, he dresses as a [[sukeban]]
* Compared to the protagonist of [[Persona 3]], [[Yuuki Makoto (persona 3)|]], he has a number of much more manly conversation/action choices

This nickname gained official acknowledgement in the PV for [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena]], in which he is called the "steel siscon banchou" (鋼のシスコン番長).

Voiced by: [[Namikawa Daisuke]] (Japanese), [[Johnny Yong Bosch]] (English)

title: hanamura_yousuke
body:
Comic relief and party member in [[Persona 4]]. Usually the brunt of jokes and bad cooking, similar to [[Iori Junpei]] of [[Persona 3]].

Uses two knives as a weapon.

His Persona are [[Jiraiya (Persona 4)|Jiraiya]], [[Susanoo (Persona)|Susanoo]] and Takehaya-Susanoo of The Magician arcana.

Voiced by [[Morikubo Shoutarou]] (Japanese) and [[Yuri Lowenthal]] (English).

title: dmitri_donskoi_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]] and [[World of Warships]] personification of the Project 65 and the Successor of the Chapayev-class cruisers.


Dmitri Donskoi is a combined effort of the Chapayev's artillery systems and the Project 65 design, one may identify her playstyle as a Heavy Cruiser than a light cruiser, she is armed with 18cm in triple turrets.


She is the second ship to be revealed as part of the Priority Research VIII.

title: 00_raiser
body:
Mecha from Mobile Suit [[Gundam 00]]. Combined form of the GN-0000 [[00 Gundam]] and the GNR-010 [[0 Raiser]]. 

In this form, the 00 Gundam's Twin Drive System is now stabilized. Its [[Trans-Am]] System is not only can be safely used now, but also grants it new abilities such as Quantization (which is often theorized as a form of short-range spatial teleportation), generating a Quantum Ethereal Plane (where those within the battlefield would have a vision of him/herself floating nude and hearing other voices), using the Raiser Sword (a massive [[energy sword]] that can extend at great distances to cut down large objects like battle cruisers and satellite weapons), and if piloted by a True Innovator, access to Trans-Am Burst System (which super accelerates high grade GN Particles, capable of encompassing an entire battlefield to influence minds, thoughts, and health of people throughout the particle field, and also causes other people to evolve into True Innovators).

The 00 Raiser retains the weaponry of both 00 Gundam and 0 Raiser. 

Its pilots are [[Setsuna F. Seiei]] (piloting the 00 Gundam) and [[Saji Crossroad]] (piloting the 0 Raiser).

title: setsuna_f._seiei
body:
Main protagonist of [[Gundam 00]] and [[Gundam 00 A wakening of the Trailblazer]]. 

He is a Gundam Meister of the paramilitary organization [[Celestial Being]]. His personal color is blue and he pilots [[Gundam Exia]], [[00 Raiser]] (particularly, the [[00 Gundam]]), and 00 Qan[T], which are all Gundams excelling in close quarters combat. He is also the first Gundam protagonist of Middle Eastern descent.

His real name is [[Soran Ibrahim]] and was a member of [[Ali Al-Saachez]]' KPSA terrorist group. Hei is also well-known for his catch phrase "I am Gundam".

Voiced by [[Miyano Mamoru]] (JP) and Brad Swaile (EN).

title: 0_raiser
body:
Celestial Being support craft. Unites with the [[00 Gundam]], forming the [[00 Raiser]] and stabilizing the twin [[GN Drive]] performance to create a more powerful [[Trans-Am]] and using it with complete safety (unlike the base 00 if it uses Trans-Am by itself, which will cause the GN Drives to overload, and risk having their total destruction as a worst-case scenario). 

As an individual unit, the 0 Raiser is equipped with GN Beam Machine Guns, GN Micro Missiles, and GN Vulcans. 

Piloted by [[Saji Crossroad]].

title: emiya_shirou
body:

A teenager with short unkempt [[orange hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Usually wears a [[school uniform]], or alternatively, a [[white shirt]] with long blue [[raglan sleeves]].

h4. Variants

* [[Senji Muramasa (fate)|]] - A Pseudo-Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] using Shirou's body as a vessel.
* [[Shirou (bear) (fate)|]] - [[Sitonai (fate)|]]'s bear familiar in [[Fate/Grand Order]], named after Emiya.
* [[Shirouko]] - A [[genderswap]]ped version.
* [spoiler][[Archer (fate)|]] - An older version from an alternate timeline whose real name is EMIYA.[/spoiler]

title: matou_sakura
body:
[[Fate (series)|]] series character and one of the main characters in [[Fate/Stay Night]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]. At school she wears the standard [[Homurabara Academy School Uniform]], while her casual clothes are a [[pink shirt]] and a [[yellow skirt|yellow]] [[long skirt]].

In [[Fate/Zero]], Sakura is [[Tohsaka Rin]]'s sister and the younger daughter of [[Tohsaka Tokiomi|Tokiomi]] and [[Tohsaka Aoi|Aoi]]. She was given away to the Matou family because the laws of the mage world prevented Tokiomi from training more than one of his daughters to carry on his family's tradition, and Tokiomi didn't want Sakura's potential to go to waste. However, [[Matou Zouken|Zouken]] is not really training her as a mage but instead putting her through hell. [[Matou Kariya]] made a deal with Zouken to win the Holy Grail in exchange for Sakura's freedom to return to the Tohsaka family, which he fails to do at the end of the series.

In [[Fate/Stay Night]], Sakura is [[Emiya Shirou|Shirou]]'s timid underclassman and [[Matou Shinji|Shinji]]'s adopted sister. She has been friends with Shirou since the previous summer when he was injured in an accident and she began visiting him with the excuse of taking care of him while he couldn't care for himself. Despite coming from the Matou family, Shinji claims she has been kept in the dark regarding magic as in a traditional magus household only the successor will be taught any magecraft (even though it's later revealed it's a lie and she's [[Medusa (rider) (fate)|Medusa Rider]]'s true master). Though she is respectful of her brother and defends his misconduct, he is in turn an abusive jerk towards her. Further, despite her upbeat attitude with Shirou, she is actually nearly silent and much gloomier when away from the Emiya household or Taiga and has no real friends apart from those two.

In [[Heaven's Feel]], Sakura becomes the love interest of the story and secrets about her life and the Matou family are slowly revealed.

In [[Fate/Extra CCC]], she is [[matou sakura (fate/extra)|reimagined as a new character]]. She created the AI named [[BB (Fate)]], who took her likeness and were assigned to monitor the moon. BB in turn created five Alter Ego servants collectively known as "Sakura Five", which were also modelled after Sakura.

In subsequent installments since [[Fate/Grand Order]], a number of servants (primarily those from the [[Hindu mythology]]) were manifested using Sakura's body as a vessel, therefore sharing her appearance. These servants along with BB and the Sakura Five were later collectively known as "Sakurafaces" by fanbase.

title: steel_ball_run
body:
Part 7 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], though separate from the "main" timeline of Parts 1-6. The part marked an entirely new continuity for the series. 

Vaguely an alternate universe analogue of Part 1: [[Phantom Blood]], this time based around a cross-country horse race taking place in America in the 1890s.

It was followed by part 8 [[JoJolion]], which continues the story left off from part 7.

title: scary_monsters_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Diego Brando]] and [[Doctor Ferdinand]] from [[Steel Ball Run]]. Allows the user to transform others or themselves into [[dinosaur]]s, to a various degree of similarity to the original animal. When in the latter form it's often depicted as a [[glasgow smile]] with [[sharp teeth]] on the stand user.

The namesake is [i]Scary Monsters (and Super Creeps)[/i], the 14th studio album by [[David Bowie]], released on 12 September 1980, as well as a song of the same name on said album.
other_names: スケアリー・モンスターズ

title: bite_the_dust_(jojo)
body:
Secondary ability of [[Kira Yoshikage]]'s [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Killer Queen]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a miniature version of [[Killer Queen]].

The tag applies both for when a small Killer Queen is shown, or when "a certain scene from the anime":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fiwcZ0pg3xM is parodied, including the explosion (for example, post #4266019).

[spoiler]Kira can attach Bite the Dust to a person that knows his secrets. If they tell anybody else in any way, that person will die. Time then loops to earlier in the day, giving Kira the chance to find out who died. Events will play out nearly identically to the first cycle, and even if the dying person doesn't learn Kira's secrets the second time around, they will still die. Kira can't use Killer Queen while Bite the Dust is active, and if he retracts Bite the Dust its ability stops.[/spoiler]


Namesake is the [[Queen (band)|]] song "Another One Bites the Dust".
other_names: 杀手皇后第三炸弹:败者食尘

title: gundam_00
body:
A 2007 [[mecha]] anime series directed by Mizushima Seiji and written by Kuroda Yousuke, and seventh incarnation of the long-running [[Gundam]] franchise.

In the year AD 2307 (the first show in the series to use the Gregorian calendar instead of alternate eras) fossil fuels have nearly ran dry, forcing the world's three supranational powers - Union of Solar Energy and Free Nations (the Americas, Oceania and Japan), Human Reform League (China, India, eastern Russia and Southeast Asia), and Advanced European Union (Europe and western Russia) - to jointly create a massive solar energy array anchored to Earth through three Orbital Elevators, even as power struggles between them threaten to break the tenuous peace.

In order to establish peace, Celestial Being, an enigmatic paramilitary organization, launched Gundams - four incredibly advanced mobile suits powered by enigmatic GN Particles - to fight all three superpowers.

Known in Japan as [i]Kidou Senshi Gundam Double-O[/i]. In [[real life]] the popular trope of a group of young Gundam pilots actually originated in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series that debuted almost two decades before 00.

title: gold_experience
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Giorno Giovanna]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a slender golden humanoid with ladybug-themed ornamentation.

Possesses several abilities revolving around the creation of life. Can transform inanimate objects into small organisms, such as animals, bugs, and plants. This power is later adapted into a healing ability, such as by transforming a bullet into the tissue it destroyed. Its main attack is a barrage of punches with a cry of "MUDA MUDA MUDA!" akin to his [[dio brando|father]] before him.

Named after the Prince album [i]The Gold Experience[/i].

h4. See also

body: Stargate Universe (often abbreviated as SGU) is a military science fiction drama television series and part of MGM's Stargate franchise. title: chibine_(fate)
body:
A dragon from [[Fate/Grand Order]].

As part of the [[Sodate! My Little Dragon]] quest, Chibine grows and can take on a total of 81 different appearances depending on the player's choices. The variables are:
* Body type (Quadruped, transitional, aerial)
* Skin color (Red, blue, green)
* Breath weapon (Fire, ice, poison)
* Horn count (None, single, pair)
It always has red eyes, a purple chest jewel, and wears a purple crown.

A fictional [[cat]] appearing in Lewis Carroll's [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]. The cat always seems to have a wide grin on its face and is often depicted as mischievous. title: murata_himeko
body:
Murata Himeko is one of the main characters in the [[honkai_(series)|Honkai series]].

Himeko belongs to Saint Freya Houkai Fighting Strategy Unit, while also the Valkyrja Squad Fifth Platoon Commander-in-chief. Her rank is Lieutenant Commander. She is a good [[captain (honkai impact)|captain]] who is fully respected from her subordinates, able to perfectly carry out the strategy, deal calmly under any adverse circumstances.

The following year after her father’s death, she responded to call of the “Valkyrie Project” of the Houkai Fighting Strategy Unit Training Program. With her natural abilities and excellent understanding, she passed through many battles and became the existence called “Ishtar of the battlefield”. In addition with her calm deposit nature, precise judgment, superior leadership, she always emerges victorious in every one of her battles.

Due to not having the resistance against the Houkai energy at birth, Himeko was forced to have her body transplanted with artificial Stigmata developed by Shicksal, in their “Valkyrja” project,  a counter measure to fight against the Houkai. However, as the result of having her body remodeled, plus the side effects from the artificial Stigmata combined with the Houkai Energy taking a toll on her body, it has been declared that she only has one more year to live.

Current age as of Honkai Impact 3rd's start: 27.

title: anglo-saxon
body:
Anglo-Saxon, term used historically to describe any member of the Germanic peoples who, from the 5th century ce to the time of the Norman Conquest (1066), inhabited and ruled territories that are today part of England and Wales.

According to St. Bede the Venerable, the Anglo-Saxons were the descendants of three different Germanic peoples—the Angles, Saxons, and Jutes.

https://www.britannica.com/topic/Anglo-Saxon

* !post #8657272

title: slapping
body:
An open-palmed strike, usually directed to one's face.

Contrary to [[punching]], a slap is mostly used to punish, wake up, stimulate or humiliate rather than harm another person. This is why it is mostly used by girlfriends, sergeants, bosses, [[bdsm]] partners, parents and teachers.

Very common in certain cultures, like [[Japan]].

h4. See also

* [[Spanking]]

title: gundam_hathaway's_flash
body:
A novel series in the UC [[Gundam]] timeline. Set in [b]Universal Century 105[/b], 12 years after the events of [[Char's Counterattack]], the novels follow the exploits of [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]] [spoiler]aka [[Hathaway Noa]][/spoiler], as he leads a terrorist cell against the [[Earth Federation]].

The novels will be adapted into a trilogy of films, with the first one released in June 11, 2021 after being delayed due to COVID-19. Previous to the adaptation's announcement, the original source material made appearances in multiple Gundam crossover games, and had it's SRW debut in [[Super Robot Wars V]].

Chronologically continued by [[Gundam F90]] and [[Gundam F91]].

title: zeta_gundam
body:
[b][i]Zeta Gundam[/i][/b] is the [[mecha]] anime 1985 TV sequel to [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. It was created by largely the same creative staff as is predecessor, but veteran designer [[Ookawara Kunio]] was assisted in mechanical designs by newcomers [[Nagano Mamoru]] and [[Fujita Kazumi]]. It also had character designs by [[Kitazume Hiroyuki]] and [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]]. 

[i]Zeta Gundam[/i] followed in the footsteps of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (1982) by including a large number of transforming [[mobile suit|MS]] [[robot]]s, a first for a [[Gundam]] show.

It is set in the year [b]Universal Century 0087[/b], eight years after the original series. It follows the story of [[Kamille Bidan]], designer and pilot of the [[Zeta Gundam (Mobile Suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]], in an interplanetary conflict known as "The Gryps War", between the oppresive and brutal [[titans (gundam)|Earth Federation Titans]] against the alliance of the valiant [[AEUG]] and the Karaba resistance organization.

The story of the series continues directly into [[Gundam ZZ]] (where it concludes).

To this day is considered by many anime critics as the most influential and best Universal Century Gundam series ever made."(1)":https://www.fandomspot.com/best-gundam-anime/ "(2)":https://screenrant.com/best-gundam-anime-of-all-time/

title: jegan
body:
A fictional manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Char's Counterattack]] from 1988.

[b]RGM-89 Jegan[/b]

The Federation's successor to the versatile but terribly underperforming [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]] [[mobile suit]] series. Tougher armor and much more power ensured the Jegan was a much greater machine than the countlessly refitted GMs it was replacing. 

The [b]RGM-89D [[Jegan D Type]] [/b] is a minor update of the type, with more flexible loadouts and minute improved sensors and thruster packs. That not much was changed showed a degree of refinement in the original design that enabled it to remain at the cutting edge of mass produced MS even at the rapidly evolving environment of the Universal Century. The Jegan was later developed into the [[Jesta]] and the [[ReZEL]] mobile suit designs.

The Jegan is also strikingly similar to another of [[Izubuchi Yutaka]]'s mechs - the iconic [[AV-98 Ingram]], from [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]].

h4. Related development

title: torque_wrench
body:
An [b]torque wrench[/b] is a more specialized ratcheting [[socket wrench]] that used to apply a specific amount of torque to a fastener, such as a nut or bolt, ensuring it is tightened to the correct specification. This helps prevent damage from over-tightening or loosening from under-tightening, by using an internal mechanism that gives an audible sound when the correct torque setting has been reached or visual display of how tight a fastener is.

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]
* [[Lug wrench]]
* [[Socket (tool)]]

title: pan's_labyrinth
body:
[b]Pan's Labyrinth[/b] (Spanish: [i]El Laberinto del Fauno[/i], "The Labyrinth of the [[Faun]]") is a 2006 Mexican-Spanish dark [[fantasy]] film, written and directed by [[Guillermo del Toro]]. It was produced and distributed by Esperanto Films.

Pan's Labyrinth takes place in [[Spain]] in May–June 1944, five years after the Spanish Civil War, during the early Francoist period. The narrative of the film interweaves this real world with a mythical world centered around an overgrown abandoned labyrinth and a mysterious faun creature, with which the main character, [[Ofelia]], interacts. Ofelia's stepfather, the Falangist [[Captain Vidal]], hunts the Spanish Maquis who fight against the Francoist regime in the region, while Ofelia's pregnant mother grows increasingly ill. Ofelia meets several strange and magical creatures who become central to her story, leading her through the trials of the old labyrinth garden. The film employs make-up, Animatronics and CGI effects to bring life to its creatures.

Del Toro stated that he considers the story to be a parable, influenced by fairy tales, and that it addresses and continues themes related to his earlier film [i]The Devil's Backbone[/i] (2001), to which Pan's Labyrinth is a spiritual successor, according to del Toro in his director's commentary on the DVD. The original Spanish title refers to the fauns of Roman mythology, while the English, German, and French titles refer specifically to the faun-like Greek character Pan. However, del Toro has stated that the faun in the film is not Pan.

The film premiered at the 2006 Cannes Film Festival. It was released in the United Kingdom on November 24, 2006. In the United States and Canada, the film was given a limited release on December 29, 2006, with a wide release on January 19, 2007. Pan's Labyrinth opened to widespread critical acclaim. The film won numerous international awards, including three Academy Awards, three BAFTA Awards including Best Film Not in the English Language, the Ariel Award for Best Picture, the Saturn Awards for Best International Film and Best Performance by a Younger Actor for Ivana Baquero and the 2007 Hugo Award for Best Dramatic Presentation, Long Form.

title: tanghua
body:
Tánghuà (糖画) is a traditional Chinese [[candy]], also referred to as sugar painting, where images are made by manipulating hot, liquid sugar against a cool work surface such as marble or metal. The resulting candy is stuck to a skewer and removed by spatula. The candy image is usually two-dimensional, but layering can create three-dimensional versions.

h4. References
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugar_painting

title: helldivers_(series)
body:
A [[science fiction]] shooting [[video game]] series developed by Arrowhead Game Studios. Set in a futuristic earth dubbed "Super Earth" where the player is part of the titular Helldivers [[space marine]]s who spread DEMOCRACY AND FREEDOM while beating up aliens and other undesirables. In reality, the government of Super Earth is actually an Authoritarian Fascist  Empire of conquest that doesn't practice democracy but a fake one called "Managed Democracy", which they brainwashed their citizens through indoctrination, propaganda and harsh laws against anyone that dare questions the state. 

A unique feature of the game is the "galactic campaign" is coordinated by every player's progress, regardless if they go solo or in a squad. Also friendly fire.

title: starship_troopers
body:
[i][b]Starship Troopers[/b][/i] is an [[united states|American]] military [[science fiction|science fiction]] novel by "Robert A. Heinlein":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_A._Heinlein], first published (in abridged form) as a serial in [i]The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction[/i] (October, November 1959, as "Starship Soldier") and published hardcover in December, 1959.

The first-person narrative is about a young human soldier of [[philippines|Filipino]] ethnicity named [[johnny_rico|Juan "Johnnie" Rico]] and his exploits in the [[Mobile Infantry]], a futuristic [[military]] unit of [[space marine]]s  equipped with [[power armor]]s and involved in an interstellar war between mankind and an [[arachnid_(starship_troopers)|arachnid]] [[alien]] species known as "the [[Bug]]s".

This book is notable because it was one of the first works of science fiction that introduced the concept of [[power suit]]s. It influenced many sci-fi anime creators and helped to create the [b]Real Robot[/b] genre of piloted [[mecha]] (The creators of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979 have cited Starship Troopers as an important inspiration).

In 1988, Sunrise and Bandai Visual produced a 6 episode Japanese OVA adaptation locally titled [[Uchuu No Senshi]].

The most famous and well known adaptation of the book is the 1997 movie adaptation directed by Paul Verhoeven and staring Casper Van Dien, Denise Richards and Neil Patrick Harris. The movie has a mixed reception: some criticized Verhoeven as he never fully read the book and viewed its themes of militarism and patriotism as resembling [[fascist]] rhetoric, which influenced the movie's portrayal of the human government; others have praised it as a prescient satire of nationalism and military propaganda.

h4. See also

* [[Marauder (starship_troopers)|]]
* [[Carmen Ibanez]]
* [[Dizzy Flores]]
* [[Helldivers (Series)|]]: Game series heavily inspired by the movie

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Starship Troopers":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starship_Troopers
* "Wikipedia: Starship Troopers (film)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starship_Troopers_(film)

title: kyokutei_bakin_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Nanmei Yumihari Hakkenden]] event. The pen name of [b]Takizawa Bakin[/b], a novelist from the Edo period who wrote [i]The Eight Dog Chronicles[/i] and [i]Strange Tales of the Crescent Moon[/i]. However, Fate's Bakin is actually summoned in his daughter-in-law [b]Tokimura Michi[/b]'s body, similar to what happens with his contemporary [[Katsushika Hokusai (fate)|]]. In her third ascension, she transforms into [b]Fusehime[/b] from [i]Eight Dog Chronicles[/i], and is accompanied by Yatsufusa.

Her [[dog ears]] and [[dog tail]] are just [[fake animal ears|part of]] [[fake tail|a costume]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[endo (takolegs)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Serizawa Yuu]]

title: summer
body:
A scene set in summer, or with a clear summer theme.

Use this tag when the setting (not just a background with seasonal vibes) shows traditional signs of summer, be it:

* [[Hot]] and sunny weather, bright [[day]]s and [[blue sky]]s.
* Light clothing, such as [[t-shirt]]s, [[shorts]], [[straw hat]]s, and [[swimsuit]]s.
* Summer activities, such as visiting the [[beach]], going [[swimming]], going to summer [[festival]]s, cooling the body with [[hand fan]]s, eating summer treats such as [[shaved ice]], [[watermelon]]s, [[popsicle]]s, etc.

h4. Examples

* !post #7970612
* !post #7921165

h4. See also

* [[spring (season)]]
* [[autumn]]
* [[winter]]

title: messer_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

[b]Me-02R Messer[/b]

A general purpose [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed from the [[Geara Doga]]. Much larger in size than its predecessor, its distinctively [[Zeon]]-like appearance was intentionally evoked by the primary users of the type - the anti-[[earth_federation|Federation]] [[terrorist]] organization [i][[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]][/i].

As such it was designed for hit-and-run tactics against more powerful and numerous opponents, being equipped with a long range [[beam rifle]], projectile weapons and average armor but high maneuverability and speed (as well as both active and passive stealth).

title: shiiko_sugai
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]] from 2025.

Contrary to what her calm, gentle and sweet demeanor may indicate, [b]Shiiko Sugai[/b] is actually a very skilled veteran [[mobile suit]] combat pilot who fought for the [[Earth Federation]] during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. 

[spoilers]Shiiko used to be called "The Witch" and became a feared [i]unicum[/i] (a MS ace), who scored over 100 kills against [[Zeon]] during the war.

She does not believe in the existence of Newtypes, but she herself is proven to be one. Shiiko is married and has [[shiiko_sugai's_son|a little son]] who looks a lot like her.

Shiiko dies in a competitive battle while using the new [[gelgoog_(gquuuuuux)|Gelgoog]]  against the [[Red Gundam]] piloted by [[Shuji Ito]], driven by homicidal rage and desire for vengeance (as the Red Gundam caused the death of her best friend and MAV wingman during The One Year War). 

In her final moments she shares a [[Newtype Flash]] connection with Shuji and sees him and also her little son.[/spoilers]

title: figarland_garling
body:
A villainous character from the manga and anime series [[One Piece]]. Unlike his lazy and weak world noble colleagues, he is powerful enough to lead the God's Knights, the elite guard of Mary Geoise, and would later become one of the [spoiler][[gorosei|Five Elders]][/spoiler] replacing [spoiler][[Jaygarcia Saturn]][/spoiler] who was killed by [spoiler][[Imu (one Piece)|]][/spoiler] as a punishment for letting [[Monkey D. Luffy]] escape.
He is the father of [spoiler]the powerful pirate [[Shanks (One Piece)|]][/spoiler] and [[Figarland Shamrock]].

title: shanks_(one_piece)
body:
A character of [i][[One Piece]][/i]. Captain of the "Red-hair Pirates", he used to be a crew member of "Pirate King" [[Gol D. Roger|Gol D. Roger]]. He was the one who gave [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] his signature straw hat and inspired him to become a pirate after he lost his left arm in a fight against a Sea King to protect young Luffy.

He's later revealed to be one of the "Four Emperors", world's four greatest pirates, along with "Whitebeard" [[Edward Newgate]], "Big Mom" [[Charlotte Linlin]] and "[[Kaidou (one piece)|]] of the Beasts".

Unlike the other Emperors, Shanks does not possesses any [[Devil Fruit]] power. However, he is an immensely skilled [[Haki (one piece)|]] users. Having mastered all three types of Haki and used them to great effect in battle. In addition, he is a highly skilled swordsman, to the point that he is capable of contending with [[Dracule Mihawk]], the "world's strongest swordsman" as one of his rival even after he lost his left arm.

[spoiler]The original owner of the straw hat is his former captain, Gol D. Roger.[/spoiler]

He is the son of [spoiler]the world noble [[Figarland Garling]][/spoiler] and twin brother of [spoiler][[Figarland Shamrock]][/spoiler]

title: a.m
body:
The [b]Allied Mastercomputer, Adaptive Manipulator, Aggressive Menace[/b], or simply [b]A.M[/b]* is a malevolent [[artificial intelligence]] and the central antagonist of the 1967 short story [[I Have No Mouth and I Must Scream]] by Harlan Ellison.

title: figarland_shamrock
body:
A villainous character from the manga and anime series [[One Piece]]. He is one of the world nobles, but unlike most of the other "celestial dragons", he's an extremely powerful fighter, enough so to become a high-ranking member of the God's Knights, the elite guard of Mary Geoise.
He's the son of [[Figarland Garling]] and the twin brother of [spoiler]the powerful pirate [[Shanks (One Piece)|]][/spoiler].

title: image_sample
body:
A [[jpeg artifacts|compressed]] or [[downscaled]] version of an image, created by a website to reduce load times or save bandwidth.

Samples should not be uploaded to Danbooru. To avoid uploading a sample, paste a link to the image on the upload page, rather than downloading the image to your computer then uploading it. Given a link to the image, Danbooru will automatically find the best-quality version of the image available.

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples with the full-size version, or delete them if the full-size version is already on Danbooru. You can ask for samples to be replaced in topic #16765, or flag them for deletion if the full-size version is already uploaded.

Not to be confused with [[sample watermark]]s, which are promotional images with a "SAMPLE" watermark. Also not be confused with [[revision]]s or alternate resolutions of the same image produced by the artist.

h4. Types of samples

* [[pixiv sample]]
* [[twitter sample]]
* [[nicoseiga sample]]
* [[tinami sample]]
* [[tumblr sample]]
* [[deviantart sample]]
* [[artstation sample]]
* [[drawcrowd sample]]

title: player_palico
body:
Japanese: [b]Otomo Airou[/b]

The customizable [[Felyne]] companion that accompanies the [[Monster Hunter (character)|]] in the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series. 

Palicoes are not pets, but rather reliable and skilled comrades that assist Hunters. Like all other Felynes, they can canonically speak human language, though until [[Monster Hunter Wilds]] they were not voice acted in-game.

Your Palico can wear a variety of armor sets based on different monsters. You can check "this search":[/tags?search%5Bhide_empty%5D=yes&search%5Bname_or_alias_matches%5D=%2A_%28palico_armor%29&search%5Border%5D=count] for a list of Palico armor tags.

title: felyne
body:
Japanese: [b]Airou[/b]

A race of "Lynians" resembling [[furry|humanoid]], bipedal [[cat]]s, from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] franchise. They come in a variety of colors, but their default coloration resembles a [[siamese cat]].

They're capable of speaking the human language and often find their way into human villages, finding employment as servants, surveyors, or [[player palico|hunting partners]] for [[Monster Hunter (character)|]]s.

[[Wild Felyne]] travel in groups and are passive unless provoked.

h4. Felyne characters

title: raymond_(animal_crossing)
body:
Japanese: [b]Jack[/b]

A smug [[cat boy]] that appears in [[Animal Crossing]]. 

He wears [[glasses]] and has [[heterochromia]], and has a little blonde hair flip on his forehead. His fashion sense and the way he decorates his house implies that he idealizes the aesthetic of the white-collar middle-manager office worker. 

Following the release of New Horizons, he gained shocking popularity online. This led to him being sold and traded like a digital commodity among players.  

h4. External links

* "Nookipedia: Raymond":[https://nookipedia.com/wiki/Raymond]

title: matara_kan
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], originally debuting as part of [[VShojo]] on October 15th, 2023. Designed by [[Kenkou Cross]] and illustrated by [[Cluseller]].

VShojo parted ways with her on May 5th, 2025.

Being a [[cockroach girl]], she has [[multiple legs]] on her back. She has [[red eyes]] and for her default hairstyle, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[antenna hair]]. Her hair also twitches much like [[cockroach]] [[wings]] do.

title: inui_arihiko
body:
A minor character in [[Tsukihime]] and [[Kagetsu Tooya]]. 

[[Tohno Shiki]]'s classmate and best friend. He is a [[delinquent]] who often skips classes and has a competitive relationship with Shiki. In Kagetsu Tooya he gains a side story delving into more of his backstory, it is there where he also meets [[Nanako (tsukihime)|]] and is the one who gave her that name.

He has an older sister named [[Inui Ichiko]].

title: pipkin_pippa_(shipkin_shippa)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Phase Connect]]'s [[Pipkin Pippa]].

It consists of a [[black dress|black]] [[pinafore dress]] over a white [[petticoat]] with [[puffy long sleeves|long puffy sleeves]], [[black footwear|black]] [[combat boots]], [[red ribbon|red ribbons]] on her [[hair ribbon|hair]] and dress, and two large [[cannon|cannons]] attached to her back.

Unlike her [[pipkin pippa (1st costume)|default]] costume, her [[official alternate hair color|official hair color]] is dyed [[black]] and her [[official alternate eye color|eye color]] changes to dark [[purple eyes|purple]] (though she has an alternate version of this costume where she has her original color scheme).

title: grimalkyne
body:
[b]Tetoruu[/b]

Lynian race from [[Monster Hunter: World]] that resemble [[furry|humanoid]] [[lynx]]es, and are similar in appearance to the [[Felyne]]. 

They live in four different tribes, with coloration depending on the tribe: [[Bugtrapper]] (brown), [[Protector (monster hunter)|]] (black), [[Trouper]] (dark teal), and [[Plounderer]] (grey). They are wary of strangers but not outright hostile, and can be befriended.

h4. See also

* [[Melynx]]

body:
[expand=Table of Contents] * "Basic formatting":#dtext-basic-formatting * "Links":#dtext-links * "Links Using ID":#dtext-id-links * "Images":#dtext-images * "Paragraphs":#dtext-paragraphs * "Horizontal Rules":#dtext-horizontal-rules * "Headings":#dtext-headings * "Quotes":#dtext-quotes * "Lists":#dtext-lists * "Expands":#dtext-expands * "Tables":#dtext-tables * "HTML":#dtext-html [/expand] DText is the name of Danbooru's custom text formatting language. It's a mishmash of several markup languages, including "BBCode":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode], "MediaWiki":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Wikitext], "Markdown":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown], and "HTML":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML#Markup]. h4#basic-formatting. Basic formatting
What you type What you get Notes
[code][b]bold[/b][/code] bold

h4#paragraphs. Paragraphs Paragraphs are separated by blank lines. A single line break inside a paragraph creates a new line instead of a new paragraph. h4#horizontal-rules. Horizontal rules Use [code][hr][/code] on a line by itself to create a horizontal rule, like this: [hr] h4#headings. Headings Use [code]h4. text[/code], [code]h5. text[/code], or [code]h6. text[/code] to create a heading: h4. [nodtext]h4. Heading[/nodtext] h5. [nodtext]h5. Heading[/nodtext] h6. [nodtext]h6. Heading[/nodtext] h4#quotes. Quotes [code] [quote] Chiyo-dad said: I wish I were a bird. [/quote] [/code] Becomes: [quote] Chiyo-dad said: I wish I were a bird. [/quote] Quotes can be nested: [code] [quote] [quote] Hello everyone~! [/quote] Oh my gah! [/quote] [/code] Becomes: [quote] [quote] Hello everyone~! [/quote] Oh my gah! [/quote] h4#lists. Lists Start a line with an '*' to make a list: [code] * Item 1 * Item 2 ** Item 2.a ** Item 2.b * Item 3 [/code] Becomes: * Item 1 * Item 2 ** Item 2.a ** Item 2.b * Item 3 h4#expands. title: blue_shell_(mario)
body:
Officially called the [b]Spiny Shell[/b].

A powerful shell in the [i][[Mario Kart]][/i] series that targets the player in first place with a large explosion, stunning them for a few seconds.

[spoilers]In [[The Super Mario Bros. Movie]], [[Koopa General]] transforms into this form and makes a suicide attack on [[Mario]] and [[Donkey Kong]].[/spoilers]

title: kamen_rider_agito
body:
Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider Agito (series)|]], eleventh show of the Kamen Rider series and second of the Heisei generation.

Tsugami Shouichi is a mysterious man who one day washed ashore with no memories, having taken his name from a letter found with him. For some reason he can transform into the mystic warrior Agito to fight the Lords, monsters responsible for mysterious deaths throughout Tokyo.

Agito's default form, [[Kamen Rider Agito (Ground Form)|Ground Form]] , has a black-and-gold color scheme, but can also change forms to suit combat situations - the red [[Kamen Rider Agito (Flame Form)|Flame Form]] , the blue [[Kamen Rider Agito (Storm Form)|Storm Form]] , the fused [[Kamen Rider Agito (Trinity Form)|Trinity Form]] , and the final [[Kamen Rider Agito (Burning Form)|Burning]] and [[Kamen Rider Agito (Shining Form)|Shining Form]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Altering (Agito)|]] ([[Rider belt]])
* [[kamen rider Agito (Ground Form)|Ground Form]]
* [[kamen rider Agito (Flame Form)|Flame Form]]
* [[kamen rider Agito (Storm Form)|Storm Form]]
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Trinity Form)|Trinity Form]] 
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Burning Form)|Burning Form]]
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Shining Form)|Shining Form]]

title: kamen_rider_agito_(trinity_form)
body:
It is one of the forms of [[Kamen Rider Agito]].
Based on the [[Kamen Rider Agito (Ground Form)|Ground Form]], the right arm is in [[Kamen Rider Agito (Flame Form)|Flame form]] and the left arm is in [[Kamen Rider Agito (Storm Form)|Storm Form]].
In this form he holds a [[Flame Saber (kamen rider)|]] in his right hand and a [[Storm Halberd]] in his left.
His finishers in this form are the [b]Fire Storm Attack[/b], in which he slashes the target with a weapon in each hand, and the [b]Rider Shoot[/b], in which he unfolds his horns like a fan and then performs a [[drop kick]]

title: frutiger_metro
body:
A visual aesthetic popular in the mid-late 2000s to early 2010s, and a derivative of [[Frutiger Aero]], mixing flat minimalist design styles with overall maximalist imagery. It derives its name from the "Metro" theme of [[Windows 8]].

Common visual elements include gradients, "bloom" or "[[flourish (design)|]]" shapes, glossy textures, [[bokeh]], [[abstract background]]s, [[splatter]] effects, [[no lineart|lineless]] vector drawings, shapes such as [[star (symbol)|]]s and circles, and [[silhouette]]s. Bright color palettes consisting mainly of lime green, electric blue, hot pink and neon orange are a staple.

Common thematic elements and motifs include nature imagery similar to Frutiger Aero, [[animal]]s like [[bird]]s and [[butterfly|butterflies]], [[speaker]]s and [[audio visualizer]]s, [[flower|floral]] imagery, and music motifs such as [[piano keys]] and [[musical note]]s.

Some notable examples of media that incorporated the Metro design language include [[Axis Powers Hetalia]], [[Persona 4]], and promotional artwork from the [[Vocaloid]] 3 era.

h4. Examples

* !post #235300
* !post #8336292
* !post #8978859
* !post #1080628

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

h4. External links

* "Aesthetics Wiki: Frutiger Metro":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Frutiger_Metro

title: an-94_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Russian [[AN-94]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. One of the members of team [[DEFY (girls' frontline)|DEFY]].

Has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[aqua eyes|aqua]]-[[blue eyes]], although artists make AN-94 [[blonde hair|lightly blonde]] usually, as a result of her original art making it look so by accident, as to make her more distinguishable from [[AK-12 (girls' frontline)|]], who also has [[grey hair]].

[[AN-94 (girls' frontline)|]] is quite reliant on [[AK-12 (girls' frontline)|]], and most commonly seen with [[AK-12 (girls' frontline)|]]. [[AN-94 (girls' frontline)|]] is among the prominent [[flat chest|flat-chested]] characters in [[Girls' Frontline]], although it is far less poked at than [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]] and [[ST AR-15 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[AN-94 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], AN-94 appears as [[Alva (Girls' Frontline 2)|]].

Voiced by [[Numakura Manami]]. Illustrated by [[Duoyuanjun]].

title: squid_game
body:
A South Korean survival drama series on [[Netflix]]. 

The first season aired worldwide on September 17, 2021. The second season aired on December 26, 2024. The third season aired on June 27, 2025.

The story revolves around [[Seong Gi-hun]], a debt-ridden gambling addict who was invited to the "Squid Game" tournament to play a series of children's games to win a huge amount of cash. He is taken to an unknown location along with 455 other people with financial issues. They later find out that the disqualified participants get killed, as well as face physical and psychological twists of the game itself.

Note: The [[green track suit]] the characters wore in the series is a very common style of Asian school uniform. Please do not tag [[Squid Game]] on any similar instance of the track suit, such as the [[meme attire]] [[China tracksuit]].

h4. Characters

* [[Seong Gi-Hun]]
* [[Cho Sang-Woo]]
* [[Wi Ha-Joon]]
* [[Kang Sae-Byeok]]

* [[Ali Abdul]]

title: aburaage
body:
Abura Age is a Japanese food product made from soybeans. Its abbreviated name is Aburage. It is produced by cutting [[tofu]] into thin slices and deep frying first at 110~120 °C then at 180~200 °C again.

It is also added to [[udon]] noodle dishes which are called [[kitsune udon]] because of legends that foxes (kitsune) like deep-fried tofu.

h4. See also
* [[inarizushi]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

title: ice_cream_float
body:
A drink consisting of 1-2 scoops of [[ice cream]] (usually vanilla) mixed with cola, root beer, or other soda beverages.

In Japanese the term "cream soda" is used to refer to an ice cream float consisting of melon soda topped with vanilla ice cream, while in North America the term "cream soda" refers to a vanilla flavored soft drink based on the taste of an ice cream float.

h4.See also

* [[Cream soda (soda)|]]

title: longan
body: Similar to [[lychee]], longans are a tropical Asian fruit that grows in clusters. It's a spherical fruit with white flesh described as distinctly musky without being too sweet and contains a black pit seed inside. Longans are also known as the "dragon's eye" fruit.

title: sono_bisque_doll_wa_koi_wo_suru
body:
A 2018-to-present manga series written & illustrated by [[Fukuda Shinichi]]. It began publishing January 19, 2018, and serialized in [i]Young Gangan[/i]. The series follows [[Gojou Wakana]], a high schooler who has a passion for making dolls and [[Kitagawa Marin]], his classmate who learns of this passion and shares her passion for cosplaying. With Gojou's skill in sewing, he helps Marin with her cosplays.

Also known as: Sono Kisekae Ningyou wa Koi wo Suru (KiseKoi). "Kisekae Ningyou" appears in the title with "Bisuku Dooru" above it in furigana.
English title: [i]My Dress-Up Darling[/i].

There is a Winter 2022 anime adaptation produced by [i]CloverWorks[/i].

h4. Characters

title: mina_(pokemon)
body:
A character introduced in [[pokemon sm|Pokémon Sun and Moon]]. She is the trial captain of Poni Island and specializes in Fairy-types. Her signature [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] is [[Ribombee]].

A [[aged down|younger]] version of her appears in [[pokemon lgpe|Pokémon: Let's Go, Pikachu! and Let's Go, Eevee!]]

* Various [[paint]] blotches on her shirt, hair, and [[facepaint|face]]
* [[blue pants|Blue]] [[torn pants]]
* [[blue footwear|Blue]] [[sneakers]]

title: duel_academy_uniform_(yu-gi-oh!_gx)
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students attending the Duel Academy in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]].

The students wear colored [[jacket]]s based on their dorm ([[Osiris the Sky Dragon|Slifer]] Red, [[The Winged Dragon of Ra|Ra]] Yellow and [[Obelisk the Tormentor|Obelisk]] Blue).

For the female uniform, they wear either a [[red jacket|red]] (Slifer) or [[white jacket|white]] (Obelisk) [[sleeveless jacket]] with a [[black skirt]] or a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]].

During the "Society of Light" arc, there is an alternate all white version of this uniform worn by the Society of Light students and [[Saio Takuma]].

h4.See also

* [[Duel Academy Uniform (Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's)]]
* [[Duel Academy Uniform (Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V)]]

Typically seen in a form known as [[darmanitan (standard)|Standard Mode]]. Darmanitan with the [[darmanitan (zen)|Zen Mode]] [[pokemon ability|Ability]] can change into an [[alternate form]] that shares its name with said Ability.

Evolves from [[Darumaka]].

title: furena
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Phantasy Star]] series of [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] role-playing [[video game]]s by [[SEGA]].

She first appeared in the [i][[Phantasy Star IV]][/i] game released in 1993.

Known in English as [b]Demi[/b].

She is an [[android]] (indicated by her [[robot ears|ears]]) that has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with a [[forehead jewel]] in the middle of [[parted bangs]], and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[yellow dress]] with matching [[yellow boots|yellow]] [[knee boots]], a [[yellow cape]], a [[blue bodysuit]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

title: bede_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Bede[/b], known as [b]Beet[/b] (ビート) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

Bede is a Gym Leader candidate from Galar with a cynical personality who calls himself one of the elite, but his heart is changing as he spends his days engulfed in pink [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Hatterene]].

He has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[curly hair|curly hair]], often depicted as either [[white hair|white]], [[grey hair|grey]] or [[blonde hair|blonde]]. By default, he wears a [[purple coat]] with a [[uneven sleeves|single]] [[sleeves rolled up|folded sleeve]]; imprinted on the back of his coat is a [[logo]], and he wears a [[purple bag|purple]] [[pouch]] on his back. He also wears a [[wristwatch|watch]], [[single glove|a single]] [[partially_fingerless_gloves |thumbless glove]], a [[Dynamax Band]], [[white pants]], and [[sneakers]].

h4. Official art
* !post #3589934: Default
* !post #9556402: Concept art

h4. See also

title: marnie_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Marnie[/b], known as [b]Mary[/b] (マリィ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Trainer from Spikemuth in the Galar region hopes to become Champion to liven up her hometown. Her battle tactics and cute appearance have earned her many fans. Her first Pokémon is [[Morpeko]].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with [[undercut]] [[asymmetrical bangs]]. She wears [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]], [[earrings]], a [[black choker|choker]], a [[pink dress]] under an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]], [[black nails|black]] [[nail polish]], [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots|boots]], and a [[red bag|red]] [[backpack]].

title: rune_factory_5
body:
The fifth installment of the [[Rune Factory]] series originally released on the Switch before being ported to PC. Notably the first game in the series where the player character is [[bisexual]] and can marry any eligible bachelor or bachelorette, regardless of the player character's gender.

h4. Characters

h5. Protagonist
* [[Ares (rune factory)|]]

title: archer_(disgaea)
body:
A popular character class in the [[Disgaea]] series who specializes in [[bow (weapon)|]]s. She appears as a young girl with [[long hair|long]] [[twin drills|twin drill]] hair and a large puffy [[blue dress]].

For the male version of this class used in [[makai senki disgaea 3|Disgaea 3]], see [[ranger (disgaea)]].

title: beliarok
body:
A [[sword]] from [[Ultraman Z (series)|]], used by the [[ultraman z|titular Ultra]] and featuring a hilt based on [[Ultraman Belial]]. It has a mind of it's own and decides whether or not it wants to be used by it's wielder.

* Ultraman Wiki: "Beliarok":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Beliarok]

title: myrtenaster
body:
Myrtenaster is [[Weiss Schnee]]'s weapon, a Multi Action Dust [[Rapier]]. Myrtenaster is highly durable, slashing away at the Giant Armor with no visible wear on the blade.

Myrtenaster's most prominent ability lies in the revolver-like mechanism held within the hilt, which contains various colors of Dust, activated by a trigger on the underside of one of the prongs. The mechanism can be opened on a hinge, allowing Weiss to replace empty vials. As a result, the weapon appears to have no tang.

RWBY Wikia: http://rwby.wikia.com/wiki/Myrtenaster

title: crescent_rose
body: [[Ruby Rose]]'s signature weapon, a red mechanical [[scythe]] with a blade at the edge of the handle that can transform into a [[bolt action]] [[sniper rifle]] or an even more compact form for transportation. The blade can also turn positions without turning the whole scythe.

title: prosthetic_arm
body:
An artificial arm, typically intended to replace a missing arm.

h4. See also

title: ember_celica_(rwby)
body:
[[Yang Xiao Long]]'s signature weapons in [[RWBY]]. They are a pair of Dual Ranged [[shotgun|Shot]] [[Gauntlets]] (DRSG). After she lost her right arm, she received [[single mechanical arm|a robotic]] [[prosthetic arm|arm]] with a shotgun installed to make up for the lost gauntlet. It was later upgraded in Volume 7, once Yang arrived in Atlas.

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wiki: Ember Celica":https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Ember_Celica

title: pulgasari_(1985)
body:
A 1985 cult classic North Korean [[kaiju]] film, mostly known for having been directed and produced by South Korean director Shin Sang-ok while being held captive by Kim Jong Il from the late 1970's to the mid-80's.

The movie follows the daughter of a blacksmith in the Goryeo dynasty, the [[Pulgasari|titular monster]] and their rebellion against a corrupt king.

title: malpha_ravencroft
body:
[[Nerissa Ravencroft]]'s older sister, also known as Oneerissa.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] [[wavy hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]]/[[aqua hair|aqua]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair]], [[long horns|longer horns]] than either of her sisters (sometimes drawn connecting together to form a [[halo]]), [[red eyes|red]] or [[purple eyes]] and even [[large breasts|larger breasts]] than Nerissa. For her outfit, she wears either a [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[white sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]] and [[blue shoes|blue]] [[high heels]], or a [[gold trim]]med [[white dress]] decorated with [[feathers]] and [[feathered wings|angel wings]] and [[white shoes|matching]] [[high heels]].

She is shorter than Nerissa, has even [[large breasts|larger breasts]] than her, and has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair]]/[[streaked hair|streaks]], [[forward-facing horns]] and [[pink eyes]]. For her outfit, she wears a [[black jacket|black]] [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed jacket]], with a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[black gloves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with an [[o-ring thigh strap]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: mustard_(pokemon)
body:
A character introduced in [i][[Pokemon SwSh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i]'s [i]The Isle of Armor[/i] DLC. Mustard is the Master of the Master Dojo. He is a former Fighting-type Gym Leader, former Galar Champion, and [[Leon (pokemon)|]]'s mentor. He is married to [[Honey (pokemon)|]] and they have a son, [[Hyde (pokemon)|]].

Trainers who clear his trials receive a [[Kubfu]].

title: gigantamax
body:
A game mechanic introduced in [[Pokemon SwSh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]]. Gigantamaxing increases a Pokémon's size and strength even more than regular [[dynamax|dynamaxing]], but unlike dynamaxing, their appearance changes significantly, as well.

An individual Pokémon needs to have a Gigantamax Factor to be able to Gigantamax. Giving the [[Max Soup]] to a compatible species will add or remove the Gigantamax Factor to it.

See [[Gigantamax (other)]] for Gigantamax forms created by fans.

title: tadawa_hideya
body:
Hideya Tawada (多和田 任益, Tawada Hideya) is a Japanese actor and model who is best known for his role as

[[Kinji Takigawa]] /[[Star Ninger]] in
[[Shuriken Sentai Ninninger]]
. He also  portrayed [[Rentaro Kagura]]/[[Kamen Rider Shinobi]] in [[Kamen Rider Zi-O Series]]

title: calico_(pattern)
body:
A color pattern based on the [[calico cat]]'s patches of white, orange and black fur. Also applies to cat people, print clothing or any other creature or object with such a pattern.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calico_cat]

title: mariah_(jojo)
body:
Mariah (localized as Mahriha in English) is one of the antagonists of [[jojo no kimyou na bouken|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]]. Her Stand is [[Bastet (stand)|]], based on the Egyptian tarot, and deity of the same name. Her name is based on artist [[Mariah Carey]].

Her ability involves the manipulation of magnetism and metal, often wielding the ability to control large metallic objects through it.

It is heavily implied that she is deeply in love with [[Dio Brando]], often comparing male enemies to him. She also may be a romantic, going as far to actively look for a romantic relationship.
other_names: マライア(ジョジョの奇妙な冒険)

title: mohammed_avdol
body:
One of the protagonists in [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 3. His [[stand (jojo)|]] is the [[Magician's Red]].

An egyptian friend of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]], he joins the group on their journey to defeat [[Dio Brando|DIO]], providing knowledge and guidance about enemy Stand Users and local cultures along the way.

h4. See also
* [[Yes I am!]]
other_names: モハメド・アヴドゥル

title: jean_pierre_polnareff
body:
One of the central protagonists in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 3: [[Stardust Crusaders]]. Also appears in Part 5:: [[Vento Aureo]] as a supporting character. His [[stand_(jojo)|stand]] is the [[Silver chariot]].

He became the origin of two Japanese well-known [[meme]]s. If you find these memes in the image, use [[Jean Pierre Polnareff]] tag and [[meme]] tag.

1) "あ…ありのまま 今 起こった事を話すぜ!" ("[i]A...arinomama Ima Okotta Koto wo Hanasuze![/i]", "L-let me tell you straight fact about what happened now!").
When a very unimaginably mysterious thing happened, this meme and his [[ASCII ART]] are used.

[quote]"Before we go after him, I have something to say!
I have barely experienced [[dio_brando|Dio]]'s stand. N-no, I have experienced it, but I don't understand what it is....
L-let me tell you straight fact about what happened now!
'[b]I was trying to climb the stairs to get him but somehow I ended up lower than where I started.[/b]'
[i]Y-you guys think I don't know what I'm talking about. I don't know what's going on at all...[/i] This is driving me crazy...
It's not something like hypnosis or super fast speed. What I experienced was just the tip of the iceberg...."
[/quote]

2) "現実は非情である" ("[i]Genjitsu wa Hijou de Aru[/i]", "Reality is Cruel")
[quote]This is a real problem. I'm injured. How can I get away?

There are three options.
One, the handsome Polnareff figures out a way to counter the attack.
Two, my friends will save me.
Or three, reality is cruel and I die here.
[/quote]

h4.See also

* Wikipedia article: "Jean Pierre Polnareff":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Pierre_Polnareff
* [[2channel]] Ascii-art Illustrations: "Polnareff":http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/Porunaref.html

* L-let me tell you straight fact about what happened now!:
** "Nicopedia article":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/1610 
* Reality is Cruel:
** "Nicopedia article":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4410936 
** "Pixpedia article":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E7%8F%BE%E5%AE%9F%E3%81%AF%E9%9D%9E%E6%83%85%E3%81%A7%E3%81%82%E3%82%8B
other_names: ジャン=ピエール・ポルナレフ

title: kracko
body:
A recurring boss in the [[Kirby (series)|Kirby series]] . Kracko is a large spiked [[cloud]] monster with [[cyclops|a single eye]] who has the power to shoot [[lightning|lightning bolts]] and can do other things that other clouds can do. He releases enemies for Kirby to suck up and spit at his eye, mainly [[Waddle Doo]]s.

Kracko is also one of many [[Demon Beast]]s in the [[kirby:_right_back_at_ya!|anime]]. He appears in Episode 4. He still shoots lightning bolts, but now he also hides within his own flying fortress in the form of a massive group of black clouds. At this time he was controlling a [[sword]] made of lightning, which Kirby inhaled and copied his [[sword kirby|sword ability]].

title: kadoc_zemlupus
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. One of the Seven Crypters, the antagonists of the second story arc of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He manages the [[Anastasia (lostbelt) (fate/grand order)|Russia Lostbelt]], and summons [[Anastasia (fate)|]] as his Servant. After the events of the Lostbelt, he's taken as prisoner by [[Novum Chaldea]] only for [[Grigori Rasputin (fate)|]] to abduct him from the [[Shadow Border]] shortly afterwards. [spoiler]He later secretly assists Novum Chaldea during the [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt.[/spoiler] He ends up allying with Novum Chaldea at the start of the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity and stays with them for the remainder of Cosmos in the Lostbelt and Ordeal Call.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Araya (hachino araya)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Akabane Kenji]]

title: anubis_(stand)
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Sealed inside of a sword. Most associated with [[chaka (jojo)|Chaka]] and [[khan (jojo)|Khan]]. Its original owner died 500 years ago.

When someone wields the sword they are possessed by Anubis, forced to do its bidding as long as they hold it. Can phase through objects when swung, cutting objects behind an obstruction without hitting the obstruction itself. Possesses the ability to "learn" an opponent's attack, allowing it to counter without fail. The longer a fight lasts, the more attacks it becomes immune to.

Namesake is the ancient Egyptian god [[Anubis (mythology)|]].

title: osiris_(stand)
body:

Looks like a muscular humanoid with veiny arms and sucker-tipped fingers.

title: xuangzang_sanzang_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Hoshi no Sanzang-chan Tenjiku ni Iku]] event. The Buddhist monk from [i][[Journey to the West]][/i]. Her [[genderswap|genderswapped]] design is a nod to the Japanese TV adaptation of [i]Journey to the West[/i] that usually chooses an actress to portray Sanzang. Also known as Xuanzang Sanzang, [[Tang Sanzang]] or Genjou Sanzou (Japanese reading).

An air-headed country girl. She only wears a [[bikini]] and a Buddhist [[robe]] in the game since she feels that the usual monk robe is "too hot and uncomfortable".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Okazaki Takeshi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Komatsu Mikako]]

title: horus_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Pet Shop]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 3. Manifests as something resembling a pterodactyl skeleton made of [[ice]].

Grants [[Pet Shop]] the ability to spontaneously create [[ice]], which is usually thrown as a weapon.

Namesake is the ancient Egyptian god [[Horus (mythology)|]].

title: baby_face_(stand)
body:
[[Melone]]'s stand from [[Vento Aureo]].

A unique type of stand that functions as a computer [[laptop]], and it requires a female host to create a "Junior". 

The "Junior" is an independent stand that could manipulate matters into cubes. It should also be noted that the "Junior" is an autonomous stand that is capable of it's own sentient thoughts; it may disobey [[Melone]]'s orders when it's not developed enough.

Both the stand and the "Junior" can be seen by normal people.

title: bad_company_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Nijimura Keicho]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests a miniature army of 60 soldiers, 4 helicopters, and 7 tanks. Their appearance is based on American GIs.

The army's weapons are loaded with live ammunition, albeit scaled down to miniature size. Regardless, the bullets from the soldiers' [[m16|M16 rifles]] can pierce human flesh and missiles from the helicopters possess real destructive ability.

Namesake is the English rock group Bad Company.

title: jojo_pose
body:
The [b]JoJo pose[/b] refers to the signature poses of the protagonists and some supporting characters on the covers and in the panels of [[Araki Hirohiko]]'s manga, [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. These poses are commonly referenced in other anime and manga due to how overly dramatic and/or [[FABULOUS]] the poses can be.

This tag encompasses various "JoJo poses" seen within the series, ranging from the one done by the the main characters to some lesser known ones without its own tags. If the pose is the one with tags (as seen below), then apply both this tag and the specific pose's tag.

h4. Poses with tags
* !asset #19808814: [[Dio Brando's pose (jojo)|]]
* !asset #19808875: [[Jonathan Joestar's pose (jojo)|]], also used by [[Caesar Anthonio Zeppeli]]
* !asset #19808874: [[Kakyoin Noriaki's pose (jojo)|]]
* !asset #19808829: [[Kujo Jotaro's pose (jojo)|]]
* !asset #19831018: [[Higashikata Josuke's pose (jojo)|]]
* !asset #19808921: [[Killer Queen's pose (jojo)|]]
* !asset #19808877: [[Giorno Giovanna's pose (jojo)|]]

h4. See also

* [[tag group:posture]]

title: dafeng_nyan-nyan
body:
A fan made character who represents ([[personification|personifies]]), plays the role of a [[mascot]], or a [[booth babe]] for the fictional company 'Dafeng Core Industry' from the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

The name Dafeng Nyan-nyan derives from the company name 大丰 'Dafeng' and 娘娘 'Nyan-nyan' (pinyin: Niang-niang), the latter means 'Lady' or 'Highness' in Chinese, as Dafeng is a Chinese themed company. 
As "originally conceptualized by Twitter user Tohuyasan":[https://x.com/tohuyasan/status/1700781531202236583], the design of the character is based on the in-game company's design philosophy: "Stout tree, Slender branches", which is interpreted by artists as [[large breasts|large]]/[[huge breasts]] [[thick thighs]], with slender limbs.

The two Hanzi character used for the company name Dafeng can be literally translated/interpreted as big and bountiful, which may have also played a role in defining the character design of Dafeng Nyan-nyan.

title: oh?_you're_approaching_me?_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from chapter 143 from [[Stardust Crusaders|Part 3]] of the [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] manga. 

It features a dramatic face-off between [[Kujo Jotaro]] and [[Dio Brando]].

h4. See also

* [[dodododo]]: Sound effect appearing in the background. Not to be confused with [[menacing (jojo)]], the other iconic background sound effect of the series.
other_names: 吼?不选择逃跑反而主动接近我吗?
ほう...向かってくるのか

title: road_roller_da!_(meme)

* [[Ore no Road Roller da! (vocaloid)|]]
* [[WRYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY]]

title: za_warudo
body:
A [[meme]] which was noticeably featured in "this flash animation":/post/show/107964 where [[Dio Brando]] and [[The World]] beat down a stickman, stopped time, threw knives, and [[road roller da! (meme)|crushed it with a steamroller]] with a cry of "[[WRYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY]]". 

The whole thing is based on the conclusion of the third story arc of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. It's also often associated with [[Izayoi Sakuya]] from [[Touhou]] due to her similar abilities. 

Unless there is a specific reference to the "ZA WARUDO" meme, it is simply [[time stop]].

title: kars_stopped_thinking_(meme)
body:
"Eventually, [[Kars (jojo)|]] stopped thinking."

A [[meme]]tic quote originated from [[Battle Tendency]]'s ending [spoiler]after the main villain [[Kars (jojo)|]] was launched into [[space]] by [[Joseph Joestar (young)|]]. Kars attempted to fly back to Earth but with no success due to space's vacuum, eventually being frozen by the coldness of space and "stopped thinking" (presumably being stuck in a coma)[/spoiler].
other_names: そのうち考えるのをやめた

title: tanuki_costume
body: An [[animal costume]] that resembles a [[tanuki]], also known as a Japanese raccoon dog. A tanuki costume often features distinctive traits such as a round belly, large eyes, and a bushy tail. In real life, these costumes are commonly worn during festivals, cosplay events, or as part of traditional Japanese folklore performances.

title: nigerundayo!
body:
The Joestar Family Secret Technique, also known as "getting the fuck out of there on your own two legs as fast as possible".

In Danbooru, this tag can either reference the running stance [[Joseph Joestar]] takes when using the "technique", or when someone says it while using said "technique".

body:
A [[stand (jojo)|stand]] in [[Stone Ocean]].

Namesake is likely [i]Planet Waves[/i], the fourteenth studio album by American singer-songwriter Bob Dylan with The Band, released on 17 January 1974.

title: highway_star_(stand)
body: Namesake is the song "Highway Star" by English rock band Deep Purple on their sixth studio album [i]Machine Head[/i], released on 25 March 1972.

title: cheap_trick
body: Namesake is the American rock band Cheap Trick.

title: pearl_jam_(stand)
body:
[[Tonio Trussardi]]'s [[stand (jojo)|Stand]]. It takes the form of a swarm of small creatures that look like they're made of various vegetables.
Namesake is the American rock band Pearl Jam. Renamed to Opal Jam in [[jojo no kimyou na bouken: all star battle|All Star Battle]] and to Pole Jam in the anime translations.

title: survivor_(stand)
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|stand]] in [[Stone Ocean]]. Described as the weakest Stand by [[dio brando|DIO]], with its sole ability being to transfer small electric shocks to people in order to make them irrationally angry.

Two possible namesakes are American rock band Survivor (active 1978-1988, 1993-present) and their eponymous debut studio album, released in February 1980.

title: manhattan_transfer_(stand)
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|]] in [[Stone Ocean]].

A possible namesake is American jazz vocal group The Manhattan Transfer (active 1969-present) and their eponymous second studio album, released on 2 April 1975.
