title: ball_breaker_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Gyro Zeppeli]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], it briefly appeared in the seventh part, [[Steel Ball Run]].
[spoiler]
It can be only summoned by Gyro's Steel Balls when it's thrown with a Super Spin.

title: dirty_deeds_done_dirt_cheap
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Funny Valentine]] from [[Steel Ball Run]]. Usually abbreviated as [b]D4C[/b] due to its long name. Manifests as a white/pink humanoid with large "horns" resembling rabbit ears.

[spoiler]Grants Valentine the power to travel to parallel worlds, even being able to bring people across with him. Should something or somebody from one world meet their counterpart in another, they will be both be destroyed. Valentine is immune to this effect, and can change places with a "parallel" Valentine should he come close to dying, with all memories transferring over.[/spoiler]

Namesake is the song and album [i]Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap[/i] by Australian rock band AC/DC. In the English translation, the name was changed to [i]Filthy Acts at a Reasonable Price[/i] to avoid copyright infringement. The Japanese transliteration of the stand's name (especially the copyright compliant version) "いともたやすく行われるえげつない行為" has become a [[neta|local meme tag]] used to refer to any mischievous acts done by a character, either with minimal effort or through blatant cheating.
other_names: ダーティー・ディース・ダン・ダート・チープ
いともたやすく行われるえげつない行為

title: wonder_of_u
body:
Wonder of U is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [spoilers] [[Tooru (jojolion)|]], [/spoilers] featured in the eighth part of the [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[JoJolion]].
[spoilers]It is a sentient [[Stand (jojo)|]]  that acts as the director of TG University Hospital using the name [[Akefu Satoru]], impersonating the identity of a retired medical professional. It is capable of causing a calamity to anyone who pursues or works against it or its user. [/spoilers] 

Wonder of U is an artificial [[humanoid robot|humanoid]] [[Stand (jojo)|]] with robotic features. It has a large torso but thin, tubular arms, with several articulations on its arms and waist. 

It wears a dark-colored [[bowler hat]] and a black suit, along with a lightly colored scarf with a pattern of irregular dash-shaped slits cut into it. It also wears dress shoes and uses a [[cane]] to walk.

Once it is revealed that [spoilers][[Akefu Satoru]] and[/spoilers] Wonder of U are the same entity, Wonder of U keeps [spoilers] [[Akefu Satoru]]'s outfit and accessories. However, it displays the hospital director's face less often to [[Mamezuku Rai]] and [[Higashikata Josuke (jojolion)|]].[/spoilers]

title: made_in_heaven_(stand)
body:
Evolved from [[C-MOON (stand)|]], it is the final [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Enrico Pucci]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a half-horse/half-humanoid entity with a clock motif and feathers around its neck.

[spoiler]Manipulates the universe's gravity on such a scale as to "speed up" time, eventually bringing reality to a "reset" point. The universe would be recreated, with everything being repeated according to "fate". Made in Heaven allows Pucci to alter the makeup of this new universe as he sees fit.[/spoiler]

Originally named after the Led Zeppelin song "Stairway to Heaven", its name was changed in the Tankōbon to the [[Queen (band)|]] song and album, [i]Made in Heaven[/i].
other_names: メイド・イン・ヘブン

title: c-moon_(stand)
body:
Evolved form of [[Enrico Pucci]]'s [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Whitesnake (stand)|]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Can make Pucci into the center of gravity, as well as turning everything it punches inside-out.

Namesake is the Paul McCartney/Wings song "C Moon".

title: whitesnake_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Enrico Pucci]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a black-and-white humanoid with a headpiece vaguely resembling a crown. The symbols "GΔCT" are repeated in bands around its body.

Possesses the power to remove special "[[cd|discs]]" from people, containing either their memories or [[Stand (jojo)|]]. Commands can also be written on blank discs and inserted, compelling the victim to fulfill them.

Namesake is the English rock band Whitesnake.

title: 20th_century_boy_(stand)
body:
The [[stand (jojo)|stand]] possessed by [[Magenta Magenta]] in Steel Ball Run,  Part 7 of the [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. 
It is a defensive stand that Magenta Magenta wears around his body to redirect all damage away from himself.

Namesake is likely "20th Century Boy", a song by the British band T. Rex, released as a single in 1973 with "Free Angel" as the B-side.

title: king_crimson_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Diavolo]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a sneering, usually red, humanoid with a smaller face named Epitaph on its forehead. When used by [[Vinegar Doppio]], the same small face manifests on his forehead instead.

Possesses the ability to predict time up to ten seconds in the future. Diavolo views the interim like "animation frames" superimposed on each other, and is able to remove sections of time as if he were deleting these "frames". To anyone but Diavolo, it appears as if time skipped forward by the amount King Crimson removed.

Namesake is the English rock band [[King Crimson]].

title: our_life:_beginnings_and_always
body:
A [[visual novel]] by GB Patch Games that combines slice-of-life, coming-of-age, and a growing-up simulator into one. The main gameplay is separated into four Steps to signify each stage of life and focuses highly on being entirely customizable from the player's every bit of appearance, mannerisms, nicknames, and personality to Cove Holden's own personality (i.e. whether he initiates conversations).

h4. Characters

* [[Main Character (our_life)|]], the customizable main character and playable protagonist, whose default name is Jamie Last.
* [[Cove Holden]], the main love interest and the boy next door.
* [[Noelani Last]] and [[Pamela Last]], the main character's two mothers.
* [[Elizabeth Last]], the main character's sister.
* [[Lee Last]], the main character's cousin.
* [[Cliff Holden]] and [[Kyra Preece]], Cove Holden's father and mother respectively.
* [[Baxter Ward]], a DLC love interest.
* [[Derek Suarez]], a DLC love interest.
* [[Gregorio Suarez]] and [[Irene Suarez]], Derek's father and mother respectively.
* [[Jorge Suarez]] and [[Nicolas Suarez]], Derek's two brothers.
* [[Jeremy King]] and [[Shiloh Fields]], two cameo characters from the creator's previous games.
* [[Miranda Eckert]] and [[Terry Brook]], the close friends of the main character and Cove Holden.

h4. See also: 
* [[Our Life: Now And Forever]]

title: special_week's_birth_mother
body:
Minor [[Umamusume]] character.

A brown-haired horse girl.

[[Special Week (Umamusume)|]]'s birth mother, who died shortly after giving birth to her, after which Special Week was raised by [[Special Week's Adoptive Mom|her adoptive mother]].

Possibly based off of Campaign Girl, the dam of the racehorse [[Special Week_(Racehorse)|]] who died shortly after Special Week was born.

title: killer_queen
body:
[[Stand (JOJO)|]] power of [[Kira Yoshikage]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4. Typically manifests as a pink, vaguely cat-like humanoid with gloves and skull emblems.

Its primary ability involves charging objects with explosive energy. When somebody touches this "booby trap", the energy flows into their body and they are caused to explode from within. This ability can also simply detonate the charged object.

Combining its power with [[stray cat (jojo)|Nekogusa]]'s Stand "Stray Cat", Killer Queen can create invisible air bombs.

Namesake is [[Queen (band)|]]'s song "Killer Queen".

h5. Secondary Abilities

* [[Sheer Heart Attack]]
* [[Bite the Dust (jojo)]]

title: sheer_heart_attack
body:
An attack used by [[Kira Yoshikage]]'s [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Killer Queen]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].  It is a heat seeking, mobile bomb that will relentlessly pursue its target, destroying anything that gets in its way. It can operate far away from Kira and is nigh-indestructible.

Namesake is the [[Queen (band)|]] album [i]Sheer Heart Attack[/i].

h4. Example
* !post #4900301
other_names: シアーハートアタック
杀手皇后第二炸弹:枯萎穿心攻击

title: tusk_act4
body: Fourth stage of [[Tusk (stand)|]], [[Johnny Joestar]]'s [[Stand (jojo)|]] from [[Steel Ball Run]].

title: diver_down_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Narciso Anasui]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 6. Manifests as a a muscular humanoid wearing what looks to be a [[snorkel]], decorated with the letter "D".

Possesses the power to phase through objects and people, allowing it to rearrange the inner workings of what it has phased into. Can reinforce an ally with this ability by overlapping their body. 
Is also able to leave an imprint of an attack and then release it upon command (such as a kick released from a footprint).

Namesake is the Van Halen album [i]Diver Down[/i].

title: foo_fighters_(stand)
body:
Identically-named [[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Foo Fighters (jojo)|]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. A group of plankton given consciousness by the effects of [[Enrico Pucci]]'s Stand [[Whitesnake (stand)|]]. 

The plankton form into an unnatural humanoid shape in its original form, and are able to shoot sections of itself off from its finger like a gun. Can separate and move extremely fast when submerged in water.

Please note that this tag is for instances where the original "inhuman" form appear and/or when [[Foo Fighters (jojo)|]] is using her "[[finger gun]]". Example: post #132883

Namesake is the American alternative rock band Foo Fighters.

title: foo_fighters_(jojo)
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 6. A group of plankton given sentience by the effects of [[Enrico Pucci]]'s Stand [[Whitesnake (stand)|]]. The plankton possess the body of a dead female prison inmate and are capable of speech. Foo Fighters is essentially a [[Stand (jojo)|]], but is described as something closer to a new species.

In her human body, Foo Fighters requires constant hydration to sustain the plankton living inside. As such, she is almost always holding a drink cup when not near a water source.

Her name is frequently shortened to just "F.F".

h4. See also

* [[Foo Fighters (Stand)]]

title: weather_report_(stand)
body:
Identically-named [[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Weather Report]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 6. Manifests as a humanoid figure made of clouds. 

Possesses the power to control the weather within a small area. Can also create thick vapors to stop attacks and fill a room with oxygen. Can freeze liquids instantaneously.

Namesake is the American jazz-rock band Weather Report.

title: purple_haze_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Pannacotta Fugo]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5. Manifests as a visored purple humanoid that may leak drool from its mouth. 

Possesses a powerful poison, which it keeps in bulbs on its fists. The poison can melt all the flesh off of an organism within 30 seconds, but is weakened in sunlight.

Namesake is the Jimi Hendrix song "Purple Haze".

title: moody_blues_(stand)
body:
[[stand (jojo)|Stand]] power of [[Leone Abbacchio]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a dark humanoid with a face resembling a cassette player.

Possesses the power to rewind time in a particular place to view a playback of the past. This playback cannot be interacted with, making the Stand somewhat like a security camera.

Namesake is the English rock band The Moody Blues.
other_names: ムーディー・ブルース

title: sex_pistols_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Guido Mista]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as six very tiny humanoids numbered 1-7 (there is no 4). Each has its own personality, but they all love eating.

The Sex Pistols attach to bullets fired from Mista's [[revolver]], allowing him to change their trajectory and ricochet off of objects freely.

Namesake is the English punk rock band [[Sex Pistols]].
other_names: セックス・ピストルズ

title: aerosmith_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Narancia Ghirga]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a miniature airplane with a separate hovering viewfinder over Narancia's eye.

The Stand is controlled by Narancia akin to an RC airplane, and is equipped with miniature machine guns and missiles. The viewfinder tracks targets by their carbon dioxide emissions, but it is ineffective in large crowds. When it fires bullets, Narancia tends to shout "BORA BORA BORA!" and then ends it with "Volare via!"

Namesake is the American rock band [[Aerosmith]].

title: sticky_fingers_(stand)
body:
[[stand (jojo)|Stand]] power of [[Bruno Bucciarati]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a blue humanoid with a spiked helmet and large ornamental zippers.

Possesses a space-altering ability to create zippers on objects, which can then be unzipped to reveal open space within. This power can be adapted to remove and reattach pieces of objects and people. It also attacks with a flurry of punches complimented with a cry of "ARI ARI ARI!" and then ended with "Arrivederci!"

Namesake is the Rolling Stones album [i][[sticky fingers (album)|Sticky Fingers]][/i].
other_names: スティッキィ・フィンガーズ

body: [[Official alternate costume]] of [[Fraux]]

title: ilsa_(formal)_(granblue_fantasy)
body: [[official alternate costume]] of [[Ilsa (Granblue Fantasy)]]

title: achtung_baby
body:
[[Shizuka Joestar]]'s [[stand_(jojo)|Stand]] that renders her invisible. She can't control it so far due to her very young age.

Namesake is [i]Achtung Baby[/i], the seventh studio album by Irish rock band U2 (active since 1976), released on 18 November 1991.

title: love_deluxe
body:
The [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] of [[yamagishi_yukako|Yukako Yamagishi]] that lets her hair become [[prehensile_hair|prehensile]], extend to great lengths, makes it very durable, strong and so on.

Overuse of the Stand and/or excessive destruction of the hair generated by the Stand lets her hair turn white for a short period of time.

The likely namesake is [i]Love Deluxe[/i], the fourth studio album by the English group Sade (active since 1982), released on 26 October 1992 in the United States and on 1 November 1992 in the United Kingdom.

For the purposes of tagging, only use this tag if Yukako's hair is shown to be prehensile or much longer than is normal for her.

title: nemo_(fate)
body:
Umbrella tag for the members of the Nemo Series from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. [[Captain Nemo (fate)|]] is the leader of the series and the first one to appear in the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|]] chapter as [[Sion Eltnam Sokaris]]' servant, with [[Marine Nemo (fate)|Marine]] only briefly appearing. The rest of the series only manifest after he declares his true name in the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] chapter and manifests the [[Nautilus (fate)|]]. The series is a result of Memory Partition he learned from his master, allowing Nemo to divide his skills up into [[multiple persona|multiple selves]] to manage all the operations of his submarine.

Although the Nemo Series' genders were initially left ambiguous, the male-to-female ratio was eventually confirmed to be 3:3 by Fate/Grand Order material XI. In-game details, such as the annual Valentine's Day event, have shed light on the genders of each Nemo: the confirmed men are Captain and the Marines, the confirmed women are Engineer and Baker, and Professor and Nurse's genders are still unknown, though Professor is implied to be female.

This is changed in the global release where only Captain is male and the rest are female.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[astg]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hanamori Yumiri]]

h4. Members
* !post #7000634: [[Captain Nemo (fate)|]]
* !asset #25666870: [[Baker Nemo (fate)|]]
* !asset #25666875: [[Engineer Nemo (fate)|]]
* !asset #25666983: [[Marine Nemo (fate)|]]
* !asset #25666876: [[Nurse Nemo (fate)|]]
* !asset #25666877: [[Professor Nemo (fate)|]]

h4. See also
* [[Nemo (Fate/Grand Order Arcade)]]
* [[Noah (fate)|]]

h4. External links
* "Type-Moon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Captain_Nemo#Nemo_Series
* "Fate/Grand Order Wiki":https://fategrandorder.fandom.com/wiki/Nemo

title: the_hand_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Nijimura Okuyasu]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a muscular armored humanoid with spikes and currency symbols decorating its body. Appears to be wearing a cylindrical helmet with an open front.

Possesses the power to erase sections of space by touching it with its right hand. This power can even be used to erase swaths of air, which pulls people and objects towards the Stand. It is also quite physically strong.

Namesake is "The Band", a Canadian rock group.

title: echoes_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Hirose Koichi]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Possesses three distinct forms, or "Acts".
* [[Echoes ACT1]]: Allows Koichi to use written onomatopoeia to cause real-world effects.
* [[Echoes ACT2]]: Similar to ACT1, but more powerful and can detach its tail.
* [[Echoes ACT3]]: Can attack an enemy with its ability, THREE FREEZE, to make it become heavier.

Named after the Pink Floyd song [i]Echoes[/i].

In the English dub, the Stand was renamed "Reverb" to avoid copyright issues.

title: crazy_diamond
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Higashikata Josuke]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a large muscular humanoid with armor and a heart-shaped helmet.

It can restore objects to a previous form, and by extension repair injuries. It cannot undo death, or heal Jousuke, however. It attacks with a flurry of punches with a cry of "DORA RA RA!"

Name is based on the Pink Floyd song, [i]Shine On You Crazy Diamond[/i].
other_names: クレイジー・ダイヤモンド

title: chariot_requiem
body: The evolved form of [[Silver Chariot]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].
other_names: シルバー・チャリオッツ・レクイエム
チャリオッツ・レクイエム

title: silver_chariot
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Jean Pierre Polnareff]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a slim, robotic-looking armored figure wielding a [[rapier]].

It's capable at moving at incredibly fast speeds, leaving many afterimages. When it removes its armor its speed is increased even more at the cost of defense. Its main weapon is a [[rapier]] which can turn into a projectile by "shooting" the blade from the hilt.

Name is based on [i]The Chariot[/i] [[Tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.

Sometimes featured with [[Konpaku Youmu]] of the [[Touhou]] series due to both of these characters being associated with swords and high speeds.
other_names: シルバー・チャリオッツ
シルバーチャリオッツ

title: hierophant_green
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Kakyoin Noriaki]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a green humanoid that can unravel into a very long elastic membrane.

It's capable of moving long distances from Kakyouin without losing power, along with being able to control other people like a marionette. Its strongest ability is a projectile attack named Emerald Splash.

Name is based on [i]The Hierophant[/i] [[tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.
other_names: 法皇の緑(ハイエロファントグリーン)
ハイエロファントグリーン

title: hermit_purple
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. It manifests as multiple purple thorny vines that spawn from Joseph's right hand. 

Besides being prehensile, the Stand affords Joseph various psychic powers, such as being able to take a photograph of somebody across the world, or tracking something on a living map made out of dust.

Name is based on [i]The Hermit[/i] [[Tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.

title: magician's_red
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Mohammed Avdol]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Represented as a humanoid figure with a bird head, it has the power to manipulate fire.

Name is based on [i]The Magician[/i] [[tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.
other_names: 魔術師の赤(マジシャンズレッド)

title: star_platinum
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Kujo Jotaro]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as what resembles a muscular Aztec warrior with wild hair and blue skin.

It's one of the most versatile and powerful stands in the series, having incredible strength, speed, precision, reaction time, and eyesight. It can only effectively operate within 2 meters of Joutarou, however. Its signature attack is a rapid barrage of punches accompanied by a repeated shout of "ORA ORA ORA!"

[spoiler]Gains the ability to [[time stop|stop time]] at the end of Part 3. Dubbed as [b]Star Platinum: The World[/b][/spoiler] 

Name is based on [i]The Star[/i] [[Tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.

For the eroge for PC-9801, see [[Star Platinum (game)]].
other_names: スタープラチナ・ザ・ワールド

title: stone_free
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Kujo Jolyne]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a bluish humanoid wearing what appear to be sunglasses.

Grants Jolyne the ability to unravel her body into a prehensile "string". The string is akin to silk, and is extremely strong when bunched or woven together. Possesses a punching barrage similar to [[Star Platinum]], complete with the cry of "ORA ORA ORA!"

Namesake is the Jimi Hendrix song "Stone Free".

title: caesar_anthonio_zeppeli

title: wamuu
body:
A central antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 2. One of the Pillar Men, ancient vampires vastly superior to those created by the [[stone mask (jojo)|Stone Mask]].  Subordinate of [[Kars (jojo)|Kars]] and [[Esidisi]].

Namesake is the British pop duo Wham!

title: esidisi
body:
A central antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 2. One of the Pillar Men, vampires vastly superior to those created by the [[stone mask (jojo)|Stone Mask]]. 

While his namesake is the Australian rock band AC/DC, it may be important to note that his character name is depicted phonetically, and is not an acronym.

title: dio_brando
body:
Main antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Parts 1 and 3, also playing an indirect, yet major, part in Part 6. Becomes a [[vampire]] during the events of Part 1 via the [[Stone Mask (jojo)|]]. Gains a [[Stand (jojo)|]] power named [[The World]] in Part 3.

Had many illegitimate children during his time as a vampire lord, most notably [[Giorno Giovanna]], the main protagonist of Part 5. Three of his other sons also appear in Part 6 as antagonists, [[Donatello Versus]], [[Rikiel]], and [[Ungaro]].

His namesakes are Ronnie James Dio and Marlon Brando.

Famous for memes such as [[wryyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy]], [[ZA WARUDO]], and [[ROAD ROLLER DA! (meme)|]].

h4. See also
* [[Kono Dio Da (meme)|]]
* [[I reject my humanity (meme)|]]
* [[Heaven Ascended Dio]]

title: jonathan_joestar
body:
Main protagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 1: [[Phantom Blood]]. His nickname is "JoJo", a name that the leading character of each following Part possesses, in one way or another. [[Dio Brando]] is his adoptive brother turned nemesis, and [[Erina Pendleton]] is his love interest. Learned [i]Hamon[/i] under the tutelage of [[Will Anthonio Zeppeli]], and also weilds the sword [[Luck and Pluck]].

His nickname, and the subsequent nicknames of his descendants, are a reference to [[the Beatles]] song [i]Get Back[/i].
other_names: ジョナサン・ジョースター

title: gyro_zeppeli
body:
[spoilers] Real name is Julius Caesar Zeppeli.[/spoilers] One of the main protagonists of [[Steel Ball Run]], alongside [[Johnny Joestar]]. A competitor in the Steel Ball Run race, he possesses control over a mysterious ability known as the [i]Spin[/i]. Bearing similarities to the [i]Hamon[/i] martial art from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Parts 1 and 2, it allows Gyro to imbue a powerful rotational force on the pair of steel balls he uses as weapons.

Distinctive traits include his [[long hair]], a wide-brimmed [[hat]] with long slits in it, teeth reading "GO!GO! ZEPPELI", and a [[beard]] made from square patches of hair. He's wearing shirt with [[high collar]] and [[short sleeves]], light [[cape]], a light belt with a harness depicting hands [[pointing]] at groin area, 3 rings on forearms and [[bridal gauntlets]] and pants fused with boots with [[spurs]].

In anime he wear changed final costume. It's long [[blonde hair]] male with [[green lips]] and [[blue eyes]] a wide-brimmed [[cowboy hat]] and grey [[goggles on headwear]] (in different from manga, on them just 2 lines on place of 3) with long slits in it, [[gold teeth|golden teeth]] reading "GO!GO! ZEPPELI", and a [[beard]] made from square patches of hair. He wear [[high collar|high collared]] [[purple shirt]] with short [[two-tone sleeves]] that colored in purple and orange, [[blue bridal gauntlets]], [[orange belt]] with a blue harness depicting hands [[pointing]] at groin area, [[brown pants]] fused with boots and [[spurs]] on them, two [[holster]] for green [[steel ball (jojo)|]], [[green cape]], in different with manga, he doesn't have 3 rings on his forearm, but only 1, and instead of a lot of rivets on shirt, he has a small number of them in x-cross shape on shirt.

[spoilers]He's became a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user with [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Ball Breaker (stand)|]], when he using golden spin.[/spoilers]
other_names: ユーリウス・カイザー・ツェペリ

title: tintin_(character)
body: Tintin is the titular protagonist of The Adventures of [[Tintin]], the comic series by Belgian cartoonist Hergé. The character was created in 1929 and introduced in Le Petit Vingtième, a weekly youth supplement to the Belgian newspaper Le Vingtième Siècle. Appearing as a young man with a round face and quiff hairstyle, Tintin is depicted as a precocious, multitalented reporter who travels the world with his dog Snowy ([[Milou (tintin)|]]).
other_names: タンタン(タンタンの冒険)

title: tolkien's_legendarium
body:
A series of high [[fantasy]] novels written by J. R. R. Tolkien that chronicles the history of the "Middle-earth". The series, particularly [i][[The Lord of the Rings]][/i] has became so influential that it codified numerous elements that can be commonly found in fantasy works today.

h4. Installments

* [[The Hobbit]]
* [[The Lord of the Rings]]
* [[The Silmarillion]]

h4. Licensed spinoffs

Works made under license from the Tolkien Estate or Middle-earth Enterprises after J. R. R. Tolkien's death.
* [[Middle-earth: Shadow of War]]
* [[Rings of Power]]
* [[The War of the Rohirrim]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tolkien's legendarium":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tolkien%27s_legendarium]

title: gaplant
body:
A fictional variable geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]ORX-005 Gaplant[/b]

A versatile transformable [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]], notably incorporating [[shield]] binders loading [[beam cannon]]s on the arms. 

The type's limited production run meant very few were dispatched, and only ace pilots such as Cyber-Newtype [[Rosamia Badam]], the brutal [[Yazan Gable]], and the main rival character of [[Ecole du Ciel]], [[Erisia Nocton]], were some of the selected few who used the powerful units.

title: the_one_ring
body:
A magical [[ring]] that appears in [[The Hobbit]] and becomes the central plot element in [[The Lord of the Rings]].
Also known as [[Sauron]]'s Ring, the Ruling Ring, [[Isildur]]'s Bane, and the Precious.
When cold it has the appearance of a perfectly smooth, unadorned [[gold ring]], but when hot it has a glowing inscription in the [[Black Speech (language)|Black Speech]] written using [[Tengwar text|Tengwar]].

h4.See also
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One_Ring]

title: genocide_route_(undertale)
body:
The [b]Genocide Route[/b] (also known as the [b]No Mercy[/b] or [b]Max LV Route[/b]) is one of three main routes in [[Undertale]], requiring the player to encounter and kill every monster in every area of the game.

Its story and gameplay diverge significantly from the Neutral and True Pacifist routes, with a majority of puzzles already being done for you (implicitly by [[Flowey (Undertale)|]]), alternate boss fights [spoiler]against [[Undyne the Undying|Undyne]] and [[Mettaton NEO|Mettaton]][/spoiler] with [spoiler][[Sans (Undertale)|]] taking the role of final boss in the Last Corridor, [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] and Flowey being defeated in a cutscene, and the destruction of the world by [[Chara (Undertale)|]].[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Upon completion of this route, the game can only be reset by making a "deal" with Chara, leading to the Pacifist Route's ending being permanently changed to suggest they had possessed [[Frisk (Undertale)|]].[/spoiler]

title: hagakure_toru
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. She is [[invisible]] due to her quirk, which allows her body to refract and redirect light. However, her clothes remain visible, as her quirk only affects her actual body.

Her likeness was finally revealed when she was shown [[unusually visible]] in an illustration (post #6220990) drawn for the series' 34th volume, depicting her with [[messy hair|messy]] [[green hair]] and [[thick eyelashes]]. Due to this, it is made clear that her "hero outfit" is simply her being [[nude]] save for her gloves and shoes.

h4. See also

* [[Deku's photo of Hagakure Toru]]

title: freedom_wars
body:
Freedom Wars (フリーダムウォーズ Furīdamuwōzu) is a Japanese action role-playing video game developed by SCE Japan Studio exclusively for the PlayStation Vita.

Set in a post-apocalyptic Earth in the year 102014,the majority of humankind is imprisoned in penal city-states known as Panopticons underground which wage war against one another. Each person is born with a 1,000,000 years condamnation, and is considered a Sinner("Togabito") that has to fight to contribute to his society; exceptions are people that can contribute by other means, like engineers, who are considered citizens. The Sinners are essentially people who can't and are sent to fight since they can't be useful to their Panopticon in another way, and try to reduce the penalty years to 0 to become citizens.

You start the game as one of the Sinners who is working to purge his sentence.

title: red_dawn
body:
A 1984 American action drama film. It depicts a [[World War III]] scenario where the [[United States]] is invaded by the [[soviet|Soviet Union]] and their allies. The story follows a group of teenage guerrillas, known as the Wolverines, in Soviet-occupied Colorado. 

It received a remake in 2012, depicting an invasion of the United States by [[North Korea]].

title: tasukete_eirin
body:
[code]
_, ,_ ∩
( ﾟ∀ﾟ)彡 えーりん！えーりん！
⊂彡
[/code]

Translates to "Help me, Eirin!"

A [[meme]] related to [[Houraisan Kaguya]] of [[Touhou]] with her calling out "Tasukete Eirin!" and making the hand gesture. The gesture doesn't have the same meaning as in the [[oppai oppai]] meme. Kaguya always relies on the help of her bodyguard, [[Yagokoro Eirin]], on many occasions. Also somewhat associated with jokes about Kaguya's [[NEET]] lifestyle. Based at least partially on the common opinion that Eirin is a more difficult boss than Kaguya in [[Imperishable Night]]. Originated from a [[help me erinnnnnn!!|song by the same name]] by COOL&CREATE.

h4. See also

* [[oppai oppai]]

title: hanasakigawa_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform|uniform]] of Hanasakigawa Girls' High School in [[BanG Dream!]].

The [[winter uniform]] is a [[brown_dress|brown]], [[double-breasted]], [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]].

The [[summer uniform]] is [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[serafuku]] with a white-collared pale blue shirt, a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]] and a [[blue neckerchief|dark blue]] [[neckerchief]].

For the Middle School branch, the students wear [[brown shirt|brown]], [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], and a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[plaid skirt]] in the winter, while their [[summer uniform]] is similar to the high school version but with different collar design and has colors of shirt and skirt reversed ([[white shirt]] and pale [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]]).

title: white_knight_(nikke)
body:
A [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] squad, comprised of [[Crown (nikke)|]] and [[Chime (nikke)|]].

They rule over the Crown Kingdom (an old castle that was originally part of an amusement park) and protect its subjects, which currently consists of [[Modernia (Nikke)|]] and [[Kilo_(Nikke)|]]. [spoiler]Their true mission is to safeguard a seed vault hidden deep beneath the castle that contains the seeds for a miracle crop to feed humanity when the surface is finally retaken.[/spoiler]

title: red_shoes_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

A member of [[Old Tales (nikke)|]] squad alongside [[Cinderella (nikke)|]], [[Little Mermaid (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]], and [[Gretel (nikke)|]]. She and her squad mates were designed to be the successors to the legendary [[Goddess (nikke)|]] squad, having modifications that rival, if not exceed, theirs.

[spoiler]It is later revealed that Red Shoes was responsible for refining the Corruption code that the [[Rapture (nikke)|]]s use to corrupt Nikkes, with her primary motive for her treachery to gain peaceful coexistence with the Raptures. She specifically targeted Cinderella because she was considered the most powerful Nikke in their squad, and is directly responsible for Cinderella's corruption into the [[Heretics (nikke)|Heretic]] "Anachiro", resulting in humanity's defeat and retreat into the Ark.

After her death, the Raptures took her eponymous legwear and Corruption code, implying that they only wanted her weaponry.[/spoiler]

Much like her predecessors and squad, her name and weapon is a reference to [[the red shoes (andersen)|the fairy tale of the same name]].

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes]] and [[huge breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white leotard]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[armored boots]].
other_names: レッドシューズ(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: micaiah_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Micaiah[/b] (ミカヤ) is one of the main protagonists of [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]]. She is a light magician from Daein, a fortune teller, and a member of the Dawn Brigade (alongside [[Sothe (fire emblem)|]], [[Edward (fire emblem)|]], [[Leonardo (fire emblem)|]] and [[Nolan (fire emblem)|]]).

She is a patriot and loves her people. She will do anything that she can to help others: this, alongside her unusual abilities, made her something of a savior for Daein and earned her the titles "Silver-Haired Maiden" and "Priestess of Dawn". Usually seen alongside her bird companion [[Yune (fire emblem)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] (with a silver tone, usually with [[bangs]]) and [[yellow eyes]]. On the back of her right hand, Micaiah poses a [[birthmark]] that vaguely resembles a "bird":[/posts/3878648]. This mark is known as a "Brand" in the Tellius Games, usually hidden behind her gloves, and a recurring element in all of her outfits.

Her most known outfit ("Light Mage":[/posts/341896]) includes a [[sleeveless dress]] with [[side slit]]s, [[black leggings]] or a [[black pantyhose]] (depends on the art), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[hair ribbon]], a [[blue scarf]], a [[belt]], [[bracelet]]s, and [[boots]]. 

Her second outfit ("Light Sage":[/posts/3839848]) incorporates many of the same design ideas, but changing the scarf for a [[blue cape]], her gloves (which are now [[purple gloves|purple]]) are also partially hidden behind [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]] and her dress is [[pink dress|pink]] and has a [[turtleneck dress|turtleneck]].

Her third outfit, [[micaiah_(queen_of_dawn)_(fire_emblem)|Light Priestess/Dawn's Queen]], makes bigger changes to her design, almost completely removing aspects of Light Mage, including making this design [[bare_legs|legwearless]]; she now has a turtlenecked [[white dress]], a [[circlet]], her fingerless gloves resemble more [[bridal gauntlets]]. Like with Light Sage, she also has a cape, though in this case it is [[red cape|red]].

In Fire Emblem Cipher (and later Heroes) she has a fourth outfit, [[micaiah_(radiant_queen)_(fire_emblem)|Radiant Queen/Queen of Silver Shine]], which not only gave her a new color for a dress ([[black dress|black]]) is also gave her a [[red coat]]; like Light Priestess, it has a circlet (though with a more complicated design) and the bridal gauntlets.

Also from Heroes, she has appeared in some additional outfits; a [[micaiah (summer's dawn) (fire emblem)|butterfly-themed Yukata]], a [[micaiah_(bridal)_(fire_emblem)|wedding dress]] (alongside Sothe), a [[micaiah (wavecrest maiden) (fire emblem)|red bikini]], and a [[micaiah (ninja) (fire emblem)|ninja outfit]] (alongside Sanaki).

Voiced in Radiant Dawn's cutscenes, [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] and [[Fire Emblem Engage]] by [[Kuwatani Natsuko]] in Japanese portrayals. In English portrayals as of Heroes, she has been voiced by Veronica Taylor.

h4. Appearance

title: kanna_kamui
body:
A character from [[Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon]]. A [[child]] thunder [[dragon girl]] with [[blue eyes]] and [[pink hair|pink]] or [[light purple hair]].

She speaks softly, and has a childish personality. As a thunder dragon, she has an ability to recharge her power via plugging her tail into a power socket.

She later gained [[meme]] status, as she was being popularlized for being a "[[loli]] dragon", thus often associated with any memes related with [[pedophile]]s.

For her [[western dragon|dragon]] form, use [[Kanna Kamui (dragon) (Maidragon)|]].

For her name origin, a thunder kamuy/deity in [[Ainu mythology]], use [[Kanna Kamui (mythology)]].
other_names: カンナカムイ(小林さんちのメイドラゴン)

title: agemasen!_(meme)
body:
"You can't have it!"
"I'm not giving it to you!"

[[Special Week (Umamusume)|]]'s memetic phrase occurring in an imagine spot in Season 2 Episode 11 of the [[Umamusume]] anime, where [[Tokai Teio (Umamusume)|]] hasn't thanked [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]].

May be used when Special Week literally refuses to hand something over (carrots), or memed further in the context of the [[Umamusume]] game when Special Week refuses to hand down a specific "skill" that the player desires. 

Other characters may also join in the fun, particularly those who are descendants of Special Week in real life, using similar phrasing and/or poses.

h4. External links
* "Original scene from S2E11 of the Umamusume anime":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZTw0CI-Lgjk]
* "Modified memed version of the above, alluding to the Umamusume game skill inheritance mechanics":[https://youtu.be/2flT5z3NtOc]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: あげません!":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%82%E3%81%92%E3%81%BE%E3%81%9B%E3%82%93!]

title: yuran_blacksnake_(rimworld)
body:
A variation of Yuran Miko class from "Yuran Race":https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2844129100 mod. Yuran Blacksnake mikos are corrupted version of Yuran Mikos in term of ability; they can reduce or increase another pawn's faith, helping in process of converting them to another Ideology. With Royalty enabled, they can perform a Psycast that either causes brain damage or straight kill their enemies---a rather horrifying power, really.

They are characterized by their ash-grey fur, black hair, electric lime colored eyes and ears' underside, as well as golden patterns on their body. Blacksnakes can dye their fur white as an attempt to 'blend' with other Yurans to scam people, but never change the color of their ears. 
Unlike normal Yuran Mikos, Blacksnake Mikos is effectively immortal due to the power of the curses contained inside their body: upon death they will create a magical formation that causes intense psychic disturbance to random biological gender and trigger thunderstorm lasting for one whole day and summons up to five snake minions to protect the formation. If the formation didn't get destroyed, a new Yuran Blacksnake miko will emerge unharmed, with some penalty to their skills.

title: demon_core
body:
A plutonium [[orb|sphere]] that was meant to be used as a core of a third [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] of the same design as [[Fat Man (bomb)|Fat Man]] to be dropped on Japan. However, after Japan's surrender, the third bomb was never assembled, and the core was later used for experiments at Los Alamos Laboratory, USA.

The core would later gain the name "Demon core" after two separate criticality accidents, each of which killed one scientist. The second incident involved Louis Slotin, a Canadian-American physicist, using a [[screwdriver]] to control the separation of two metallic half spheres (neutron reflectors) around the core. Upon the screwdriver slipping out, the half spheres closed completely and the assembly immediately became supercritical, releasing a burst of [[radiation]], more specifically [[Cherenkov radiation]]. This procedure specifically has became a subject of several minor memes in the Japanese community, usually to suggest a character is habitually oblivious or reckless.

In 2022, a [[meme]] revolving around the Demon Core suddenly became popular outside of Japan, possibly due to "Kyle Hill's":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFlromB6SnU] and "Plainly Difficult's":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VE8FnsnWz48] videos covering the object. Several artists and animators have created works involving various characters replicating Slotin's experiment.

h4. See also

* [[Cherenkov radiation]] - the blue light emitted from the Demon core while going supercritical

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Demon core":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon_core

title: yuran_(rimworld)
body:
Taken from the korean modpage, with some translation: "Yurans are alien race with the appearance of humanoid rabbit; their exact origin is not known. A minority race with all-female member due their unique genetic makeup, they continue existing by assimilating males from other races."
"Their society are built around individuals with special abilities called Mikos, which gets passed down by lineage. They live in small-sized villages, and their faith centers on a large cherry tree in their hometown."

Like an albino rabbit, Yurans has pure white hair, white fur, and red eyes. They only have four digits each on their limbs, and a small fluffy tail on their backside. Their appearances in what looks like distinctively eastern clothing are generally perceived by other races as beautiful, with charming voices and exotic appearances. At such, their settlements are often targeted by slave hunters and bandits aiming to kidnap members of their race to be sold or to be 'enjoyed'; but this isn't all negative for them, since that also means they can continue their lineage that way. Other than that, Yuran Mikos has the notable power to sway one's faith or summon miracles such as changing weather, improving immunity gain speed for sick pawns or improving general luck of the settlement: these miracles requires a ceremony to be performed, which usually demands the special kind of sake Yurans brew from a mixture of rice and cherry fruits from their specialized trees.

title: kamura_(armor)
body:
The distinctive starting armor from [[Monster Hunter Rise]]. So called because it's the signature hunter outfit for the monster-hunting warriors of Kamura Village, the player character's home town. 

The design of the set seems to take inspiration from traditional ninja outfits, but with many "hunter" flairs added, such as utility straps and pieces of animal pelt. 

An upgraded edition of the armor exists: the Kamura S Set, which has better stats but an identical appearance.

Its [[Player Palico]] counterpart is [[Kamura (palico armor)]].

title: c-ms_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Swedish "CBJ - Modular System", or [[CBJ-MS]]/C-MS for short,  in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has a [[long hair|long]], [[messy hair|messy]] [[black hair]]. She has [[red eyes]] with [[mole under eye|mole]] under her right eye. Her clothes are a [[jacket]] with many [[belt]] in it, with a long shirt. It is unknown if she is wearing anything underneath said shirt. She wears a single black thighhigh with a knee pad on it. She wears boots.

Official character description states she tends boss people around that includes that player, however she treats her subordinates well which may show she has a soft side.

Later on, she received a number of skins, one that turned her into a [[aged down]] child version of herself, one that gave her a swimsuit and a tan, and a Halloween one which made her into a corpse bride.

title: m3_grant
body:
The Medium Tank M3 was an American [[tank]] used during [[World War II]]. Design commenced in July 1940 as a desperate attempt to mount a 75mm gun onto any possible chassy. Coupled with the United Kingdom's immediate need for tanks of any sort to replace those left behind at the [[Dunkirk evacuation]], the M3 began production by late 1940 and first saw action in 1941.

The tank is easily identified by its peculiar design, with the main 75mm gun in a casemate sponson on the right side of the hull, and a smaller turret atop the hull mounting a 37mm gun. In addition, the British also outfitted some M3 tanks with British-pattern turrets, visually identified by their top turrets looking "flatter" compared to the ones from the United States. In accordance with British practice to name their Lend-Lease tanks after generals from the [[American Civil War]], tanks with the taller, American-made turrets were named for [[Robert E. Lee]], while those with the smaller, British-made turrets were named for Ulysses S. Grant. 

h4. Appearance 

* !post #7336142: [[M3 Lee]]
* !post #2415523: [b]M3 Grant[/b]

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "M3 Lee":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M3_Lee

title: bottomless
body:
Nude from the waist down. Wearing a top, but no bottoms. 

For example, wearing a [[shirt]] or other top without any [[pants]], [[underwear]], or other bottom clothing.

When considering if a character qualifies the post for this tag, follow the rules below.

h5. Rules for usage

* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is fully [[nude]].
* [b]Do not use[/b] when you can't see the character's upper body. You should be able to tell the character is wearing a top.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is wearing [[panties]] or [[underwear]]. Use [[no pants]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is wearing a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] without underwear. Use [[no panties]] or [[no male underwear]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is pulling their [[panties]] or [[underwear]] down or aside.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is only wearing a [[pantyhose]]. In this case, use both [[no pants]] and [[no panties]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] for [[monster girl]]s or [[monster boy]]s who don't normally wear clothing from the waist up. Use [[nude]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] [[bare legs]] with this tag.
* Wearing [[garter belt]], [[garter straps]], [[maebari]], [[thighhighs]], [[socks]], or [[shoes]] still counts as [[bottomless]].
* If you can't tell that the character isn't wearing [[underwear]], use [[no pants]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #18256: Basic bottomless
* !post #52206: Bottomless one-piece swimsuit
* !post #114711: No bikini bottom
* !post #8814138: Bottomless with thighhighs

h4. See also

* [[No panties]]
* [[No pants]]
* [[No male underwear]]
* [[Topless female]]
* [[Topless male]]
* [[Topless other]]
* [[Tag group:Sexual attire]]

title: topless_other
body:
Nude from the waist up. Not wearing a top, but wearing bottoms. For example, wearing [[pants]] without a [[shirt]].

h6. Guidelines

* Don't use when the character is [[nude]] or [[completely nude]].
* Don't use when you can't see the character's lower body. You should be able to tell the character is wearing bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use if the character is wearing a [[bra]] or [[bikini top only|bikini top]]. Use [[no shirt]] instead.
* Don't use [[bare shoulders]], [[bare back]], or [[bare arms]] with this tag.
* Don't use for [[monster]]s who don't normally wear bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[bottomless]]
* [[no shirt]]
* [[topless male]]
* [[topless female]]
* [[Tag Group:Sexual Attire]]

title: topless_male
body:
Nude from the waist up. For example, wearing [[pants]], [[shorts]], [[male swimwear]] or [[male underwear]] without a [[shirt]] or other upper-body clothing.

h6. Guidelines

* Don't use when the character is fully [[nude]].
* Don't use when you can't see the character's lower body. You should be able to tell the character is clothed below their waist, if you cannot, use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use if the character is wearing a [[jacket]], [[coat]], [[overalls]] etc without a [[shirt]]. Use [[no shirt]] instead if they're wearing it with lower-body clothing, or the appropriate [[naked_*]] tags (like [[naked jacket]]) if they're only wearing that article of clothing.
* Don't use [[bare pectorals]], [[bare shoulders]], [[bare back]], or [[bare arms]] with this tag.
* Don't use for [[monster boy]]s who don't normally wear clothing from the waist down. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Wearing [[suspenders]], [[midriff sarashi]] or [[pasties]] still counts as [[topless male]].
* Wearing [[chest harness]], [[chest belt|belt]] or revealing tops like [[o-ring top]] doesn't count as [[topless male]]. Use [[bare pectorals]] or other appropriate tags instead.

h4. See also

* [[bottomless]]
* [[bare pectorals]]
* [[no shirt]]
* [[topless female]]
* [[topless other]]
* [[Tag Group:Sexual Attire]]

title: completely_nude
body:
Wearing no clothing from the neck down.

This means that non-clothing items or small accessories that don't cover much skin, such as [[glasses]], [[hat]]s, [[jewelry]], [[wristband]]s, [[anklet]]s, [[tail ribbon]]s, [[belt]]s, [[shibari]] [[rope]]s, etc, don't count against this tag.

Non-clothing items that are worn like clothing, such as [[naked towel]]s, do count against the tag. Items used to hide the naked body, as in [[nude cover]], don't count against the tag. [[Naked chocolate]] or other such fluids covering the body also don't count against the tag.

If you can't see their crotch or lower, use [[nude]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[nude]]
* [[Tag Group:Nudity]]
other_names: 生まれたままの姿(産まれたままの姿)

body: Bugchan (AKA: Pestys) is a series created by [[Sechi (Sechihyeo)]] about bug-like girls known as Pestys. For now, that series is mostly focused on a mosquito-like girl called [[Mosquitochan (Sechihyeo)|]] and other girls based on a Worm, Ant and a Ladybug

title: miracle_matter
body: The supposed final boss of [i][[kirby_64|Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards]][/i]. Serving as a mastermind of [[Dark Matter (kirby)|]] (and second-banana to [[zero_two_(kirby)|0²]] by extension), it is a mysterious [[icosahedron]] that is capable of replicating [[Kirby]]'s [[copy_ability|copy abilities]] to use against him in battle. Kirby can only use the respective copy ability against it to defeat it (for example, Kirby can only use [[cutter kirby|Cutter]] against Miracle Matter's own Cutter).

title: zero_two_(kirby)
body:
After his defeat at the end of [[Kirby's Dream Land 3]], [[Zero (kirby)|]] (now with [[wings]] and a [[halo]], not looking too far off from a [[seraph]]) returns as the true final boss of [[Kirby 64]]. Not to be confused with [[Zero Two (darling in the Franxx)|]] from [[Darling in the Franxx]] or [[Zero II (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]].

h4. See also
* [[Dark Matter (kirby)|]]
* [[Miracle Matter]]
* [[Void Termina]]
other_names: ゼロツー(星のカービィ)

title: nanashi_mumei
body:

On March 28th, 2025, "she announced":[https://www.youtube.com/live/4qCfplhCk6A] that she would be graduating from hololive. Her "final stream":[https://www.youtube.com/live/tTABc1SlO8U] was on April 28th.

She has [[brown eyes|golden-brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]] with [[white hair|white]] and [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] on her [[sidelocks]]. An [[ahoge]] sticks out of the top of her head, and her [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[crossed bangs]] reach [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].

title: chamber_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 4
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can add 1 "Dragonmaid" Spell/Trap from your Deck to your hand. At the start of the Battle Phase: You can return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 or higher "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Chamber Dragonmaid" once per turn. [/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1800


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Initially being the only member of the archetype that do not have a draconic form until the release of [[Dragonmaid Cehrmba]] in 2024. As indicated by her name, her duty is cleaning and preparing the house's bedchambers. She is also depicted using a feather duster and a mop made up of her [[feathered wings]]. 

Chamber is often depicted as being shy in multiple fan arts may be from her emotion from card artworks. In the Card Game Art Works, she is described being bad at expressing herself. Later, Chamber is later depicted as being a jealous senior due to the debut of [[Lady's Dragonmaid]] completely overshadow the addition of her dragon form.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・チェイム

title: lady's_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level[/b]: 8
[b]Attribute[/b]: LIGHT
[b]Type[/b]: Dragon / Fusion / Effect

[i]2 "Dragonmaid" monsters with the same Attribute but different Levels
Must first be Special Summoned (from your Extra Deck) by banishing 1 each of the above cards from your field and GY. You can only use each of the following effects of "Lattice Dragonmaid" once per turn. If this card is Special Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 Level 4 or lower "Dragonmaid" monster from your Deck. During the Standby Phase: You can Fusion Summon 1 Dragon Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, by shuffling its materials from your field and/or banishment into the Deck.[/i]

[b]ATK[/b]: 2000 
[b]DEF[/b]: 3000

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. She is first introduced in 2024 and is currently the newest member of the archetype.

She is frequently paired with [[Chamber Dragonmaid]] in fanarts, typically as Chamber's one-sided "rival". This is due to her debut overshadowed Chamber receiving [[Dragonmaid Cehrmba|her long anticipated dragon form]] that were introduced in the same set.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ラティス

title: pitching
body: In [[baseball]], pitching is the term referring to when the pitcher throws the [[baseball (object)|ball]] at the opposing team's batter, aiming to strike the batter out by delivering the ball to the [[catcher (baseball)|]] without letting the batter hit it. Typically this is done from atop the [[pitching mound]].

title: pitcher_(container)
body:
A container with a handle and spout that allows [[water]] or other liquids to be easily poured into a [[cup]] or a [[drinking glass]].

A small pitcher used to hold condiments is a [[creamer (vessel)|]].

Used for serving drinks, not [[pitching|throwing baseballs]].

Not to be confused with a [[jug (bottle)|]].

"A 'jug' is a large bottle":[https://i.imgur.com/6I5tu69.png] (like the plastic gallon jugs used for milk or the older glass gallon jugs used for cider or fruit juice). Examples: post #4657026, post #2931700.

"A pitcher":[https://i.imgur.com/echI4pG.jpg] is a large open mouthed container for pouring drinks, it's a dish itself, not something you'd buy from the store. Examples: post #2625448, post #1801140. The [[Kool-Aid Man]] (post #113823) is a walking talking pitcher.

title: joey_cadogan
body:
A [[Dead by Daylight]] character and a member of [[the legion (dead by daylight)|"The Legion"]]. He is impulsive and likes to show off, which is perhaps why he was said to be unable to keep a job prior to entering The Fog. He is long-time friends with two other members of his group, [[Julie Kostenko]] and [[Susie Lavoie]].

His base cosmetic does not come with the DLC and must be purchased from the in-game store. It features a [[black hoodie]], a [[black bag|black]] [[fanny pack]] worn across his back, [[black_gloves|black]] [[work gloves]], [[grey pants|grey]] [[cargo pants]], [[brown shoes|brown]] [[sneakers]], and a [[black mask|black]] [[balaclava]]-like [[skull mask]] with black [[facepaint]] around his eyes. His weapon of choice is a [[karambit]]. He has [[dark skin]] that can only be seen in the comic or when viewing his body cosmetic with another member's mask. For that reason, it is not uncommon for Japanese artists to be unaware of this fact and draw their unmasked design of him with a lighter skin tone.

title: alchemist
body:
The progenitor of the modern [[chemistry|chemist]]. Alchemists are practitioners of alchemy, or the study of an early, unscientific form of chemistry practiced in the Middle Ages with aims including turning base metals into gold and discovering the elixir of perpetual youth, a universal cure for disease, and a universal solvent.

The [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series of video games is designed around this premise, with the main protagonists being alchemists.

title: bustier
body:
A firm-fitting undergarment, usually worn as [[lingerie]], designed to push up the [[breasts]]. A bustier resembles a [[bra]], but longer, extending beneath the breasts to cover part of the waist and stomach. The length may vary, but a bustier usually ends above the [[navel]].

The difference between a bustier and a [[corset]] is that a corset has laces or buttons in front, is usually longer and made of stronger material, usually doesn't cup the breasts, and is usually is tighter around the waist. A bustier is usually shorter (above the navel), usually cups the breasts, and is designed mainly to hold up the breasts, not to hold in the waist.

In addition, a bustier should not be confused with an [[underbust]], which denotes attire worn below—and not on—the breasts.

h4. Examples

* !post #314129
* !post #434924
* !post #546192
* !post #3970140: A bustier worn with an [[underbust]]

h4. See also

* [[corset]]
* [[Tag group:Attire]]

title: lambert_egitte_blaiddyd
body:
Background character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]], deceased prior to the game's events.

Lambert was the late King of Faerghus and father of [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd]]. He was favored to take the throne of the Kingdom over his brother Rufus, as the latter did not bear the Crest of Blaiddyd. [[Rodrigue Achille Fraldarius]] was his best friend and attended the Officers Academy together with him.

[spoiler]Lambert tragically lost his life in the Tragedy of Duscur; his dying words incited Dimitri to one day avenge him and everyone else who had fallen in the battle. Dimitri would go on to carry this emotional burden for years, which eventually drives him mad.[/spoiler]

title: azure_striker_gunvolt
body:
[b][i]Azure Striker Gunvolt[/i][/b] (Japanese title: 蒼き雷霆ガンヴォルト, pronounced as アームドブルー・ガンヴォルト, Armed Blue Gunvolt) is an action side-scrolling platforming series developed by "Inti Creates":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inti_Creates with some input from "Keiji Inafune":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keiji_Inafune, and it is Inti Creates' first independent video game series. The series serves as a spiritual successor to the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series. The series started with [i][[Azure Striker Gunvolt 1]][/i], and follows the titular [[Gunvolt]].

The series later gained a sequel, [i][[Azure Striker Gunvolt 2]][/i], which takes place a few months after the events of its predecessor, where Gunvolt crosses paths with an Adept-hunting avenger named [[Copen (gunvolt)|]] (EN) / Acura (JP) from the previous game as they encounter a group of Adepts known as Eden, whom harbor a hatred towards humans, seeking to use Joule's powers to wipe out humans and create a new utopia for Adepts. A gaiden game, [i][[gunvolt chronicles luminous avenger ix|Gunvolt Chronicles: Luminous Avenger iX]][/i], later follows after the events of [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt 1[/i] and focuses on Copen. There are also supplementary materials that expands on the serie's world and characters, such as [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt: Fleeting Memories[/i], prequel story taking place before the first game, as well as an OVA based on the first game released through the Nintendo 3DS eShop. Gunvolt also made an appearance in [i][[Mighty Gunvolt]][/i], a retro-inspired spin-off series of games also from Inti Creates that features a cross-over of [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt[/i], [i][[Mighty No. 9]][/i], and [i][[gal gun|Gal☆Gun]][/i]. The series gains a third game in [i][[Azure Striker Gunvolt 3]][/i], set years after the events of [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt 2[/i].

h4. Characters

h5. Main characters

* [[Gunvolt]]
* [[Joule (gunvolt)|Cyan (JP) / Joule (EN)]]
* [[Lumen (gunvolt)|Morpho (JP) / Lumen (EN)]]
* [[Acura (gunvolt)|Acura (JP) / Copen (EN)]]
* [[RoRo (gunvolt)|RoRo (JP) / Lola (EN)]]
* [[Kirin (gunvolt)|]] 

h5. QUILL / FEATHER

* [[Asimov (gunvolt)|]]
* [[Gino (gunvolt)|]]
* [[Monica (gunvolt)|]]

h5. Sumuragi Group

h5. GV2

h5. GV3

h4. See also

* [i][[Mighty No. 9]][/i], a spiritual successor to the classic [i][[mega man (classic)|Rockman]][/i] series by Keiji Inafune and co-developed by Inti Creates
* [i][[Mighty Gunvolt]][/i] and [i][[Mighty Gunvolt Burst]][/i], a spin-off series also featuring Gunvolt, Beck from [i]Mighty No. 9[/i], and Ekoro from [i]Gal☆Gun[/i]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azure_Striker_Gunvolt]
* "Official website (English)":[http://www.gunvolt.com/en/]

title: kuzuha_(3rd_costume)_(nijisanji)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Kuzuha (Nijisanji)|]]. It is [[ChroNoir]]'s 1st [[matching outfits|matching]] [[Kanae (7th Costume) (Nijisanji)|costume]]. 

He wears a [[black jacket|black]] [[open jacket]] that is [[red jacket|red]] on the inside. His [[black vest]] with [[gold trim|gold strings]] is visible from the front. His first layer is a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]]. His [[black pants|black]] [[pants]] are held by both a [[white belt]] around his waist and two [[black belt]]s that wrap around him from behind and attach on either side of the front. He has [[black boots]].

Usually, his hair is tied in a [[low ponytail]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]].

Usually, he's wearing a [[choker]], a [[hat]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], and a [[headset]] as well in this outfit.

title: yuruyuri
body:
A manga series by [[namori]], serialized in Comic YuriHime since 2008, and adapted into an anime in the Summer of 2011. A second anime season was released in the summer of 2012. An OVA titled YuruYuri Nachuyachumi! was released in 2014. During a event related to OVA's release a 3rd season was announced to be come in production early 2015. The third season, called "YuruYuri San Hai!", aired in October 2015.

YuruYuri follows the everyday life of schoolgirls at a fictitious junior high school. The year before the series starts, [[Toshinou Kyouko]] and [[Funami Yui]] take over the former room of the school's Tea Ceremony Club to form the Amusement Club. When Kyouko and Yui's friend [[Akaza Akari]] enters their school, she immediately becomes part of the club. One of Akari's classmates [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]] also ends up joining the club. Members of the student council often visit the club.

Spin-offs have been made: [[Oomuro-ke]], [[Risetto!]], [[Touzainanboku!]] and [[Tensei Shitara Akari dake ga Slime Datta Ken]].

title: shoujo_kageki_revue_starlight

Shoujo Kageki Revue Starlight (lit. Girls' Musical Revue Starlight) is a Japanese media franchise. It primarily consists of a 2017 musical, a 2018 anime series, and three manga adaptations.

title: jackenstein_(deltarune)
body:
A miniboss from chapter 4 of [[Deltarune]]. He's a large but cowardly and childlike Darkner with [[patchwork skin]] and a [[jack-o'-lantern head]] [spoilers](in truth a [[pumpkin mask|mask]] covering a small, [s]terrifying[/s] wormlike face)[/spoilers].

Notable for his unconventional boss fight in which the player must collect treasure and a [[key]] in a maze to gain TP, and after picking up the latter must return to the entrance while a red [[jack-o'-lantern]] chases them after proclaiming "[[typo|YOUR]] TAKING TOO LONG".

title: yuka_(rhythm_tengoku)
body:
A character from the [[Rhythm Tengoku]] series, appears in every game in some form and is considered by the community the mascot of the series. Her most well-known appearance is in the stage "Tap Dance" ("Tap Trial" in English) [[dancing]] with [[monkey_(rhythm_tengoku)|monkeys]], which shows her having [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[ponytail]], and wearing a [[red dress]] with [[red footwear]]. She's also seen wearing different clothes in the series' "Remixes".

She's often called the "Tap Trial girl" by the community.

A [[girl (minna no rhythm tengoku)|very similar looking girl]], though without a proper name, also appears in the title screen for [[Minna no Rhythm Tengoku]].

* !asset #23356337: from "Tap Trial" in the original [[Rhythm Tengoku]]

h4.See also
* [[Girl (Minna no Rhythm Tengoku)]]

title: upa_(style)
body: A modernist graphic style based on the work of United Productions of America, an animation studio known for such cartoons as the [[Mr. Magoo]] series of animations and [[Gerald McBoing-Boing]]. Typical to this style are flat colors, solid lines, and abstract techniques such as minimalist backgrounds or color offset from line art.

body:
A fictional variable geometry manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Sentinel]]. 

[b]MSZ-006A1 Zeta Plus[/b]

The mass produced version of the powerful but extremely complex and expensive [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. Using design features taken from the [[Hyaku Shiki]] to simplify the transformation process, the unit was finally made manageable enough to make it into production.

title: sasumata
body:
The sasumata (spear fork) is a pole weapon used by the samurai class and their retainers in feudal Japan. It was used as a policing tool used to arrest people, with the forked end used to capture a person's neck or limb. 

It's [[Eosinophil (hataraku_saibou)|]] from [[Hataraku Saibou]]'s weapon of choice. They are also commonly used by the characters of [[Chiikawa]].

h4. See also

* [[naginata]]
* [[polearm]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sasumata":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sasumata

title: space_habitat
body:
A large habitation facility in [[space]] similar to a very large [[space station]], but designed as a permanent settlement. Frequently seen in far-future [[sci-fi]] works.

Space colonies are commonly depicted in shapes such as massive cylinders or toruses (donuts).

h4. See also

* [[Dyson Sphere]]
* [[O'Neill cylinder]]
* [[Ringworld]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Space habitat":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_habitat]

title: o'neill_cylinder
body:
A [[space habitat]] design by American scientist "Gerard K. O'Neill":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerard_K._O%27Neill]. He called that particular design "Island Three" in his 1976 book "The High Frontier: Human Colonies in Space":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_High_Frontier:_Human_Colonies_in_Space].

This cylinder-type design is known for appearing (and [[colony_drop|being dropped]]) in most of the [[Gundam]] series ("with a few exceptions":[http://gundam.wikia.com/wiki/Space_Colony#Additional_Colonies]). 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: O'Neill cylinder":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/O%27Neill_cylinder]

title: world_war_ii
body:
[b]The Second World War[/b] (abbreviated "WWII" or "WW2") was a major worldwide [[war]] that was first set off by the [[second_sino-japanese_war|Japanese invasion of Manchuria]] and then officially began when [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] attacked [[Poland]] on September 1st of 1939 and ended after [[Japan]] surrendered on August 15th of 1945. It is considered a result of the outcome of [[World War I]].

The belligerents formed two major factions, the Allied Powers (or "Allies") and the Axis Powers (or "Axis").

[b]World War II is considered the deadliest military conflict in human history[/b]. Over 60 million people died as a result of the fighting and/or resulting resource shortages, as well as deliberate mass killings throughout the war, and hundreds of millions were displaced or left destitute in the aftermath. WW2 can also be considered the deathblow to the old European empires which had dominated history up to that point; the war left them financially, militarily, and culturally even more exhausted than they had been after WW1 and saw the rise of two new super-powers with a rather anti-colonial bent to them: the [[soviet|USSR]] and the [[united states|USA]], thus kickstarting the [[Cold War]].

Technologically, WW2 saw the first usage of the many trends that still dominate warfare to this day: the first modern [[missile]]s and [[rocket]]s were used during WW2, [[aircraft carrier]]s replaced [[battleship]]s as the dominant surface warfare vessels, unmanned radio controlled vehicles saw limited use during the war, and [[StG 44]], the world's first assault rifle, entered service during the later half of the war. The most important and influential technology used, however, is the first (and only) usage of a [[nuclear weapon]] in the history of warfare: [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|when the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki were destroyed by the atomic bombs dropped by the USA]].

This tag can be applied if the image is related to World War 2, such as featuring technology (tanks, aircraft, warships or weapons) of the era, uniforms & troops, or battle scenes.

h4. Participants

h6. The Allies

* [[Yugoslavia]]

* [[India]]

h6. The Axis

body: The main antagonist of [[Deltarune]]'s first chapter. A [[fat]], blue and white [[king of spades]]-themed [[humanoid]] Darkner with [[sharp teeth]], a [[stomach mouth]] and a [[spade (shape)|]] motif.

title: queen_(deltarune)
body:
Main antagonist of [[Deltarune]]'s second chapter and Queen of the Cyber World. Appears as a [[computer]]-themed Darkner resembling a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped [[King_(deltarune)|]] (whom she's implied to have a past with) with a black [[screen]] in place of her eyes.

Also Has An Odd Speech Pattern Where Every Word Is Capitalized And She Rarely Uses Punctuation (Except When: Imitating Text Templates)

title: shirouzu_(gundam)
body:
A character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]] from 2025.

The mysterious [b]Shirouzu[/b] looks very similar to [[Char Aznable]] ([[Mobile Suit Gundam]]/[[Gundam GQuuuuuux]]), [[Quattro Bajeena]] ([[Zeta Gundam]]), [[Johnny Ridden]] ([[MSV-R: The Return of Johnny Ridden]]),  [[Glemy Toto]] ([[Gundam ZZ]]) and [[Full Frontal]] ([[Gundam Unicorn]]). 

He is voiced by [[Shin Yuuki (voice_actor)|]] ([[Kyle McCarley]] in the English Dub), the same voice actor(s) for Char Aznable in GQuuuuuux.

[spoiler]Eventually revealed to be the Char Aznable of the GQuuuuuux universe.[/spoiler]

title: ufo
body:
Short for "Unidentified Flying Object". Stereotypical depiction of an [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] originated from various description of the supposed spotting of alien spacecraft during the 1950 - 1970s "UFO craze" around the Americas.

The most common depiction of UFO are a "[[flying saucer]]", a disc-shaped spacecraft often with a glass canopy for its occupant. Though other types such as a sphere and a cigar-shaped UFO is also often depicted.

h4. See also

* [[Flying saucer]]
* [[Tractor beam]]
* [[UFO Day]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Unidentified flying object":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unidentified_flying_object]

title: jupiter_(planet)
body:
Fifth and largest [[planet]] of the [[solar system]], located between [[Mars (planet)|]] and [[Saturn (planet)|]]. A gas giant with multiple [[moon]]s and a faint [[planetary ring|ring system]]. Its most prominent feature is its massive [[Great Red Spot]].

Among its many moons are the four Galilean moons: [[Io (moon)|]], [[Europa (moon)|]], [[Ganymede (moon)|]] and [[Callisto (moon)|]].

h4. See also

* [[Jupiter symbol]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jupiter":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jupiter]

body:
Alter-Ego Pseudo Servant who inhabits the body of [[Kotomine Kirei]]. This tag refers to him in his Father Kotomine persona, seen during the second major story arc of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He was eventually released as a playable Alter Ego-class Servant for the 2023 New Years event, under his full name [b]Grigori Rasputin[/b]. He also incorporates elements of "Azi Dahaka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zahhak and "Bahloo":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahloo. His display name changes with his ascension.

body:
Character from [[Warhammer 40k]] and [[Warhammer Fantasy]].  Chaos God of excess, usually associated with sexual deviancy.

Like the rest of the Chaos Gods, they are genderless. Unlike them, Slaanesh often takes the form of either a man, a woman, or a hermaphrodite with both masculine and feminine features.

title: weiss_schnee
body:
Weiss Schnee is one of the main characters of [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth. 

Weiss is the "W" in RWBY, and is associated with the color white. Her character design is inspired by [[Snow White (fairy tale character)|]].
[[Winter Schnee]] is her sister. As heiress to the Schnee Dust Company, her life has been marked by pressure. Her arrogant and prickly exterior hides a softer heart. 

h4. Abilities 
She wields a sword/revolver hybrid weapon named [[Myrtenaster]], a "Multi-Action Dust [[Rapier]]" (MADR). Her symbol is a snowflake, and [[magic circle|magic circles]] ("glyphs") appear when she uses her semblance (special ability).  

h4. Physical characteristics 
Weiss has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] off to one [[side_ponytail|side]]. She has a [[scar]] [[scar_across_eye|over]] her left eye.  

She stands 5' 3" tall (including [[high heels]]). 

h4. Attire

She usually wears a [[tiara]] in her hair, around her ponytail, and often wears a bit of jewelry: [[earrings]] and a [[necklace]] with [[pendant]]. Her default outfit includes a white [[cropped jacket]] with a [[high collar]] (revealing the red interior lining) and [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]], a blueish-[[white dress|white]] [[strapless dress]] with [[lace-trimmed skirt]] over a [[petticoat]], and blueish-[[white boots]] with [[high heel boots|high heels]]. Her [[belt]] is a [[ribbon]] tied with a [[bow]] in front, holding a [[belt pouch]] with Dust supplies on her back.  

Her Beacon [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[neck ribbon]], brown [[blazer]], and [[plaid skirt]].  

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wikia: Weiss Schnee":https://rwby.wikia.com/wiki/Weiss_Schnee

title: asirpa
body:
An [[ainu]] girl and one of the main characters in [[Golden Kamuy]]. Her name means "new" (アシㇼ, "asir") and "year" (パ, "-pa") in the Ainu language.

Asirpa is an expert at [[bow_(weapon)|bowhunting]], ainu cuisines and "reaction faces":[/pools/2265]. She is a childhood friend with a [[white wolf|white]] "Hokkaido wolf":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hokkaido_wolf] called [[Retar]]. Accompanies [[Sugimoto Saichi]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]]. She wears [[ainu clothes]] warm [[white boots]], [[black pants]], [[blue bandana]] on head, [[hoop earrings]] in ears, and [[white boots|white]] [[fur cape]]  over the other clothes.

h4. See also
* "Wiki page":[https://goldenkamuy.fandom.com/wiki/Asirpa]

title: feather_(magia_record)
body:
A Feather is a low- or mid-ranking member of either Wings of Magius, Neomagius or Chargius within the [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]] universe.

They are characterized by a uniform featuring a hooded garment with a print of a given organization's symbol and a [[pendant]] shaped like [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]].
 
Within Wings of Magius, that uniform consists of a [[black cloak|black]] or [[white cloak|white]] [[cloak]] with a [[hooded cloak|hood]] featuring a print of a moth's eyes and antennae.

Chargius uses the same design as Wings of Magius, except the cloak is [[yellow cloak|yellow]].

Neomagius further divides the outfits depending on their ranks:
* A Black Feather's uniform consists of a [[hood]] with a print of [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]], the aforementioned pendant, a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[turtleneck dress|turtleneck]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[tabard]] and [[blue pantyhose|blue]] [[pantyhose]].
* A White Feather's uniform consists of a [[hood]] with a print of [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]], the aforementioned pendant, a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[frilled sleeves]], a pair of [[bracelet]]s, [[white gloves]], a [[tabard]], [[blue pantyhose|blue]] [[pantyhose]] and [[white boots]].

h4. External links
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Wings of the Magius":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Wings_of_the_Magius]
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Neomagius":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Neo-Magius]

title: terriermon
body:
A Beast Digimon. As a Child-level, it is not very powerful, but widely regarded as cute, and its easygoing personality makes it a favorite of young Tamers. 

Not to be confused for [[Lopmon]], which it greatly resembles. Terriermon are white with green accents, while Lopmon are brown with pink accents.

There's an official alternate form called [[Terriermon Joshu|Terriermon Assistant]], who acts as an assistant to [[Agumon Hakase]].

title: honest_brute
body:
"Honest" Brute is a mercenary and leader of Doser gang Junker Coyotes from [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], who pilots the AC '[[milk tooth (armored core vi)|MILK TOOTH]]'.

He defected the black market arms dealer organization RaD with the [[railgun|Overed Rail Cannon]] he have stolen. In-game, [[621 (armored core vi)|player]] will be tasked by [[cinder carla|"Cinder" Carla]] to eliminate him and take back the rail cannon.

As a Doser, or someone who uses Coral as a recreational drug, his attitude can be described as eccentric: he considers Carla as a "friend" even after his betrayal, he talks to his AC and the [[railgun|rail cannon]], and thinks AC fight as a ballroom dance. As such, him and his quotes have become a [[meme]] among Japanese fans.
other_names: オーネスト・ブルートゥ

body:

Featured prominently in an early episode of the Korean drama series [i][[Squid Game]][/i], where players are required to cut out one of three shapes from the candies without causing them to break.
