title: hand_truck
body:
An L-shaped tool for moving boxes and other heavy loads. Hand trucks consist of a vertical frame with handles, a flat plate the load sits upon, and a pair of wheels at the base. The hand truck is slid beneath the load to be moved, then tilted back so that the weight of the load is balanced above the wheels.

title: gundam_unicorn
body:
7 episode [[Gundam]] OVA series running from 2010-14, adapted from the 10 volume novel series by Harutoshi Fukui. Occurs in [b]Universal Century 0096[/b], three years after [[Char's Counterattack]].

The series revolves around the pursuit of Laplace's Box, a MacGuffin said to contain a secret that could bring down the [[Earth Federation]] government, by [[Neo Zeon]] remnants calling themselves "The Sleeves" and Londo Bell, the [[earth federation space forces|EFSF]] special taskforce from Char's Counterattack. The titular [[Unicorn Gundam]] acts as both a map and key to the Box, coordinates to which are encrypted in its operating system.

Chronologically continued by [[Gundam Narrative]].

h4. Related characters

* [[Banagher Links]], pilot of the Unicorn Gundam
* [[Audrey Burne]], aka Mineva Lao Zabi
* [[Riddhe Marcenas]], a Londo Bell pilot and son of a prominent family in the EF government
* [[Full Frontal]], leader of The Sleeved, described as "the second coming of [[Char Aznable]]"
* [[Angelo Sauper]], Full Frontal's lieutenant, reminiscent of [[Gyunei Guss]]
* [[Suberoa Zinnerman]], captain of the Garancieres, a Sleeved ship masquerading as a cargo freighter
* [[Marida Cruz]], a pilot for The Sleeved who refers to Zinnerman as "Master"

h4. Related mecha

title: kamishibai
body:
[b]Kamishibai[/b] (lit. "Paper theatre") is a form of Japanese entertainment medium that became popular during the early 20th century, though it suffered a decline after the widespread introduction of movies and television after World War II.

Essentially a primitive form of motion pictures, kamishibai involves the narrator who told the story through describing the scene depicted on a paper sheet contained inside the box, switched the sheet as the story progressed, and often voiced the characters all by themselves.

title: camellya_mascot_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a [[Wuthering Waves]] offline event in South Korea to celebrate the game's first anniversary. The most well-known picture depicting the meme involves a [[Camellya (Wuthering Waves)|]] mascot leaning forward with her hands down, however it may also appear in other forms such as the mascot fast drawing a sword or even in other characters such as [[Yangyang (Wuthering Waves)|]].

The mascot costumes have been present at previous offline [[Wuthering Waves]] South Korea events however they did not achieve widespread meme status until the 2025 first anniversary offline event in South Korea.

This tag predominantly refers to the widespread pose however it can also be used in any case where the likeness of the mascot costume is shown.

h4. Examples

* !asset #25971360
* !asset #26030516

title: roxie_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Roxie[/b], known as [b]Homika[/b] (ホミカ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon bw2|Black 2 and White 2]][/i].

Highly popular in the Unova region, this [[bass guitar|bassist]] balances her time between her band and being a Poison-type Gym Leader. Her signature Pokémon is [[Scolipede]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[white hair]] worn in a [[topknot]]. She wears [[hair bobbles]], a [[striped dress|striped]] [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] dress, and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform boots|platform]] [[boots]].

title: ethereal_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
Enemies found in the Hollows of [[Zenless Zone Zero]] where they are born. Both living and artificial beings can become corrupted into Ethereals from prolonged exposure inside a Hollow.

While they vary greatly in appearance, they most often resemble human-like creatures with black bodies that are accented with glowing neon-green segments.  Generally they have a mix of biological and crystalline traits, along with a black sphere which is their "core". A weak spot that is guarded with armor. 
More powerful Ethereals have white crystals on their body and their green color is replaced with pink.


h4. Characters

* [[Nineveh (zenless zone zero)|]]

h4. External links

* "Zenless Zone Zero Wiki: Ethereal":https://zenless-zone-zero.fandom.com/wiki/Ethereal

title: doom_(series)
body:
[b]Doom[/b] (stylized as [b]DOOM[/b] or [b]DooM[/b]) is a franchise of first-person shooter [[video game]]s developed by [[id Software]], and related novels, comics, board game, and film adaptations. 

The series focuses on the exploits of an [[Doomguy|unnamed space marine]] operating under the auspices of the Union Aerospace Corporation (U.A.C.), who fights hordes of [[demon]]s and the [[undead]] in order to survive.

h4. Related tags

title: futsuu_no_keion-bu
body:
[i]Futsuu no Keion-bu[/i] (lit. "Ordinary Light Music Club"), also known as [i]Girl meets Rock![/i] in the English localization, is a 2024-to-present manga written by "Kuwahali":[https://x.com/kuwahali] and illustrated by [[denai tetsuo|Ideuchi Tetsuo]].
The story follows 15-years old [[Hatono Chihiro]]'s musical journey as she pick ups the electric guitar and joins her high school's light music club. In spite of the series' title, she soon discovers that the club is anything but ordinary.

title: radiant_silvergun
body:
[i][b]Radiant Silvergun[/b][/i] (レイディアント シルバーガン) is a [[science fiction]] vertical shoot 'em up [[video game]] by [[Treasure (developer)]]. It debuted in arcades in 1998 on the S-TV [[arcade]] board and sequentially saw a port to the [[Sega Saturn]]. 

The game features a unique weapon system different from other shooters; instead of the traditional power-up items found in other games, the eponymous Silverguns are equipped with seven different weapons that can be powered-up by using that particular weapon and effective scoring. 

Among the Silverguns' arsenal is a powerful sword that can perform a devastating attack upon filling a special attack meter. Its other unique aspect was its chain scoring system where by destroying three enemies of the same color will result in a "Chain Bonus" that accumulates as the player chain the same-colored enemies in succession.

It is one of the most sought-after Sega Saturn games around; it was never released outside Japan unfortunately, and import copies of the game can fetch around high prices at auction sites due to its rarity and legacy. Thankfully, in 2011, it saw an enhanced re-release on [[xbox_360|Xbox 360]] for 1,200 Microsoft Points ($15 U.S. Dollars) via Xbox LIVE Arcade, with optional HD graphics, English translated subtitles, and online multi-player.

h4. See also

* [[ikaruga|Ikaruga]], Radiant Silvergun's spiritual successor.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Radiant Silvergun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radiant_Silvergun
other_names: レイディアントシルバーガン

title: don't_hug_me_i'm_scared
body:
A British psychological horror-comedy series, presented like a typical kid's show that then gets increasingly horrific over the course of each episode.

The original 6-episode web series was gradually produced and then released on YouTube between 2011 and 2016 and has proven very popular, with each episode having at least 20 million views as of 2021. A TV series was aired on Channel 4 with the 1st season airing from 30 September, 2022 to 14 October, 2022.

title: kisaragi_chihaya
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. While naturally talented, Chihaya is less enthusiastic about the "idol" aspect of her career, preferring classical music, and is actually rather awkward with other people. Well-known for her occasional insecurity regarding her rather [[flat chest]].

Her mother is [[Kisaragi Chigusa]]. [spoiler]She also has a deceased younger brother, [[Kisaragi Yuu (idolmaster)|Kisaragi Yuu]].[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Imai Asami]] and, in [[Idolmaster Xenoglossia]], [[Shimizu Kaori]].

title: nanami_(mignon)
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Mignon]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] stylized in [[short twintails]] with [[bangs]], and a [[mole]] [[mole under eye|under her right eye]].

She is a part of the swim club wearing a [[blue one-piece swimsuit|blue]] [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece]] [[swimsuit]].

title: ichigo_(mignon)
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Mignon]].

She is a school girl with [[medium hair|medium lengthed]] [[black hair]] stylized with [[bangs]] and a [[strawberry hair ornament|strawberry shaped hair clip]], [[pink eyes]], and [[small breasts]].

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[blue shirt|blue]] [[shirt]] with a [[pink cardigan|pink]] [[cardigan]] [[cardigan around waist|around her waist]], [[red necktie|red]] [[necktie]], and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[skirt]].

She is often paired with [[Ame (mignon)|]].

title: ai_hyperion_lambda
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] character, serving as the in-game assistant to the [[Female dreamseeker (honkai impact)|Dreamseeker]] for Part 2. A time crystal entity unrelated to [[Ai-chan (honkai_impact)|Ai-chan]] despite their similar appearance. Voiced by [[Horie Yui]] in Japanese. 

She is still portrayed with the same [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] tied into [[double bun]]s, and [[orange eyes]], but has a mature and taller physique with [[large breasts]]. She uses a [[chakram]] as her main weapon.
